loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 23 years old and single with no children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cucumbers and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Sara needs a loan to buy seedlings, insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 

She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Irmma Eva

texts.es: La señora Irmma  vive en la Provincia Loayza, de educación secundaria pero no termino el bachillerato, de estado civil soltera, tiene un hijo del cual se hace responsable sola, desde muy niña vio como trabajaban sus padres y asi aprendió la agricultura, el trabajo en la tierra es muy pesado pero cada dia se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo, la tierra que tiene cultivada es una herencia de sus padres en la cual ya tiene cultivado algunos productos y cuenta con plantaciones frutales, actualmente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de abono natural, plantines de durazno y fertilizantes. Lo que incrementara sus productos para tener mayores ingresos y así podra ahorrar para el futuro de su hijo y adquirir mas terrenos.
texts.en: Irmma lives in Loayza Province. She finished secondary school but not high school. Her marital status is single and she has a son, whom she cares for on her own. Ever since she was a little girl she saw how her parents worked, and that is how she learned how to farm. Farmwork is very hard but she gives it her best effort daily in order to provide for her child. She inherited the land she farms from her parents, and she is already growing some products and fruit plantations there. She currently needs to request a loan to buy manure, peach tree seedlings, and fertilizer. This will increase her production and her income, which will allow her to save up for her son's future and to buy more plots of land.

loans.use: to buy peach tree seedlings, manure, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Karina Lisseth

texts.es:
Karina de 26 años de edad, ella estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor.
Karina toda su  vida se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar, además ayuda a su pareja a sembrar maíz y pipián el terreno de donde lo hacen está a unos 35 minutos y se van en bicicleta; más que todo lo hacen en la mañana de 7 a 11 am.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar veneno, fertilizantes y abono para que los cultivos sean más vigorosos y resistentes a plagas y enfermedades; ya que sembrara 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y otros 10,500 de pipián. Espera obtener buenas ganancias en la venta de sus productos para seguir trabajando las tierras y mantener a sus hijos y que tengan siempre la posibilidad de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old and went as far as seventh grade in school. She lives with her partner, who is a farmer.

Karina has done housework all her life and also helps her partner grow corn and squash. The parcel of land where they do this is some 35 minutes away and they travel there by bicycle. They usually do this in the morning from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

She needs the loan in order to buy pesticides, fertilizers and manure, so that the crops will be healthier and resistant to pests and diseases. She will plant 10,500 m² of corn and another 10,500 m² of squash. She hopes to obtain good earnings from selling her crops, so that she can continue working the land and supporting their children. She hopes they always have the chance to continue their education.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizers and manure so that her crops will be healthier and resistant to pests and diseases.

loans.name: Toi

texts.en:
Toi is a 49-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business selling pancakes. To earn extra income, she also makes and sells ice-cakes. 

Toi needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a strainer, a barrel of cooking oil and plastic bags.  For her ice-cakes she'll also be buying foam cups and cordials. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Toi joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a strainer, a barrel of cooking oil and plastic bags, and for her ice-cakes she'll also be buying foam cups and cordials.

loans.name: Mohsina

texts.en:
Mohsina is a 22-year-old single lady who is the sole earner of her family and is responsible for the living of four other members of her family. Mohsina has been working as a sales person in a roastery for five years, with a good experience in her domain.

Mohsina is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to get ready for her engagement. She needs to pay for some of this event’s expenses.

She hopes to improve her work and get a wide degree and a better position in her work.

loans.use: to pay for her engagement expenses.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene 19 años de edad nacida en la provincia Campero, es madre soltera  tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Actualmente vive en casa de sus padres en el trópico de Cochabamba, tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel primario ya que los escasos  recursos de sus padres no le ayudaron a seguir estudiando,  empezó a trabajar desde muy joven y con su ahorro compro su propio lote agrícola hace 2 años, donde cultiva piña y yuca con la ayuda de su padre, todo iba bien hasta que ella conoció al papa de su hijo quien al enterarse que estaba embarazada la abandono, pero ella tuvo el valor de seguir adelante y tener a su hijo sola, su lote agrícola no cuenta con los servicio básicos, porque es un lugar alejado de la población, ahora solicita un crédito para poder ampliar su plantación de piña y a si mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 19 years old. Born in the province Campero, she's a single mother. She has one dependent child. Currently she lives in her parents' house in the tropics of Cochabamba. She has a primary school level of education, since her parents' scarce resources didn't help her to continue studying. She started to work when she was very young, and with her savings she bought her own agricultural lot two years ago, where she grows pineapples and yucca with the help of her father. 

Everything was going well until she met the father of her child, who abandoned her when he found out she was pregnant. But she had the courage to keep going and raise her child on her own. Her agricultural lot doesn't include basic services because the location is far from town. Now she's asking for a loan to be able to expand her pineapple farm and in this way improve her standard of living.

loans.use: expand her pineapple farm

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is 57 years old and has two children who are now working. She sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family. Josefina’s family was one of those affected by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost.

Josefina buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of the freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Josefina is taking out a loan of PHP 25,000 to continue operations of her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she hopes to make a big improvement in her family's life and financial situation. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to be sold at the market.

loans.name: Kumushay

texts.ru: Кумушай, 36 лет, замужем, 4 детей. Образование - среднее. На протяжении 16 лет занимается садоводством и полеводством, у нее есть 0,15 ГА огорода, 0,36 ГА земельного надела, а также 0,12 ГА сада. Всю самостоятельно выращенную продукцию, она реализует на местном рынке или оптовым покупателям. Кумушай на сегодняшний день успешный предприниматель, она получает ежемесячную прибыль около 10 000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего полеводческого хозяйства, Кумушай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры для обработки земли. На доходы от кредита Кумушай планирует улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Kumushay is 36 years old, married and has four children. She has a secondary education. For the past 16 years, she has been practicing gardening and crop farming. She has a 0.15 hectare vegetable garden, a 0.36 hectare plot of land and a 0.12 hectare orchard. She grows all of her fruits and vegetables by herself and sells them at the local market or to wholesale buyers. Today, Kumushay is a successful entrepreneur - she receives an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her crop farming business, Kumushay turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy saltpeter fertilizers to cultivate the land. Kumushay plans to use the earnings from the loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy saltpeter fertilizers to grow eco-friendly fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina, 31, lives in Jarmundi village in the Dumka district in Jharkhand with her husband Akshay and her three children.  All her kids go to school. Rina is a member of the local NGO “MESP”. Her husband is an Astrologer by profession and earns around INR 300 to 400 per day, which is not at all adequate to maintain the family along with the children’s education costs.
 
The couple now plans to start a photo printing paper business. They will sell the photo printing paper to photo studios in nearby areas and to individual photographers. To start this business, Rina is requesting a loan of INR 12,000 as initial working capital. They are hoping to make some profit with this business.
 
This loan will help Rina and her husband Akshay in securing a better life. They want to see their children as achievers so that they will be in a respectful position in society in the future.

loans.use: to start a business selling photo printing paper

loans.name: Ean Keavy Group

texts.en: Keavy is 24 years old. She is a farmer growing rice and feeding pigs. She lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She earns approximately $10 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of 10,000,000 Riels as a group of 5 members to build latrines. This will help her live in a better condition. In the future, she is going to open a hair salon in Phnom Penh City and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build new latrines.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 27-year-old woman, who is unwed with 2 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Imeleta has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

loans.name: Vaiomanu

texts.en: Vaiomanu is 32 years old and unwed with 3 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Vaiomanu needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Vaiomanu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 4 years. Matalena needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Judie

texts.en:
Judie is a hardworking entrepreneur from Coron Palawan, Philippines. He is 50 years old and married to Luningning. He has three children who are currently in school. He catches and sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family. Judie ’s family is one of those affected by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. He has restarted his business operation and is committed to regain what they lost.

Fishing is one of the common sources of income in the Philippines since most of the folks live near the seashore. Among them is Judie. First thing in the morning, he prepares his fishing tools and accessories like nets, rod holders, bait prep and tanks, grippers, knives and more. After hours of bearing the scorching heat of the sun, he will go back to the shore with other fishers with their nets full of tons of fresh-caught fish. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Judie needs to add more tools and equipment for fishing. That is why he is taking out PHP 10,000 loan assistance to continue operating his business. He will be utilizing the loan to improve his service and to be able to catch more fish which are necessary to increase his profit.

In the future, he wants to have more boats for fishing.  He also hopes to improve their general living condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and accessories needed for fishing.

loans.name: Sifou

texts.en: Sifou is a 49-year-old widow with 1 child. She owns and operates a small flea market, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 1 year. Sifou needs a loan to buy samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and samoan designed caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and samoan designed caps.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more fish net, scotch brite, steel wool and other products. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. His wife is helping him in generating income for their family.
 
He would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs as well as the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gregorio hopes that his business will grow and expand even bigger. He dreams that his family will always be in good health and condition. He hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish net, scotch brite and steel wool for resale.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en: Eline is a 33-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience in this business. Eline needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is 49 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Bessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soap, shampoo, spices, etc. to sell.

Bessie has been in this business for 30 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Bessie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soap, shampoo, spices, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Phares

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Phares, a 51-year-old man who resides in the Chuka area in Kenya. He is very humble and a go-getter. He is a father of seven children, and has one wife. Phares has been practicing farming for the last 15 years on his small plot, where he does mixed farming.

Phares enjoys farming so much, and every day he wakes up to go to the farm and improve his life. Through farming, he has been able to take care of his large family and provide the basic needs to them. 

Having the traits of a go-getter, Phares has always dreamt big. He has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. That is why he is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to start a cereal-selling shop and make his dream come true. With your loan, Phares will be able to improve his income levels and be able to comfortably take care of his family.

Phares' projections are that by the end of the first year he would be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. 

Through the profits generated from the business, he would be able to pay the loan and provide a secure future for his children and wife.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 58 years old and married. She has eight children. 

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarita has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Clarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ergie

texts.en:
Ergie is 27 years old and married with two children who are in school. Ergie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, sardines, etc. to sell.

Ergie has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Ergie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, sardines, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Dulmaa, 37 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a high school teacher since 2012. Her husband provides taxi services to local people. Their two daughters both go to high school. The house and fences they own have deteriorated over the years and need some serious repair. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: El  Señor Cristóbal vive en concubinato con la Señora Benedicta tiene tres hijos dependientes a los cuales ayuda con la alimentación y educación, vive en el Trópico de Cochabamba con toda su familia, se dedica a la agricultura hace muchos años, necesita ayuda económica y por eso solicita un crédito para realizar el mantenimiento y ampliación de sus cultivos de cítricos porque lamentablemente está atravesando una crisis y sus ingresos no le son suficientes, de esta forma podrá incrementar su producción y así también lograra mejorar económicamente para brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida , el señor demuestra ser una persona responsable, seria y trabajadora y se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante.
texts.en: Cristóbal lives with his partner, Benedicta, and their three dependent children for whom he provides food and education. He lives in the Tropic of Cochabamba with his family, and has worked in farming for many years. He needs economic support, which is why he is requesting a loan to maintain and expand his citrus crops because, unfortunately, he is going through a hard time and his income isn’t sufficient to support him. This loan would enable him to increase his production, as well as his income, so that he can give his family a better quality of life. Cristóbal is a responsible, serious, and hardworking person who strives every day to get ahead.

loans.use: to maintain and expand his citrus crops.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Coron Palawan, Philippines. She is 42 years old and has five children who are currently in school. She and Roderick, her husband, manage a fruit stand business and their income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures. Crisanta’s family is one of those affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost.

She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells mangoes, coconut, citrus fruits, and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.
 
Crisanta is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

In the future, Crisanta hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies. Crisanta meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruits and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lourdes dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups which meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 55 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, eggs. etc.

Marlyn has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Marlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Yik's Group

texts.en:
Yik is 32 years old and has two children. She lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To earn a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. 

Yik is requesting her fourth loan, and the first loan for her co-borrower. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield. Her prior loans have enabled her to uplift her lifestyle in a gradual way.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 42 года, замужем, 4 детей. У Назиры среднее образование, на притяжении 17 лет вместе с супругом активно занимаются полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Назиры есть 3 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 2 лошади и 25 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 2,04 ГА, где выращивают картофель, ячмень, эспарцет и пшеницу. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 12 000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Назира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15 000 сом (KGS) на покрытие расходов по сбору сена, что позволит обеспечить ее скот собственным кормом, а в будущем и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Nazira is 42 years old, married and has four children. Nazira has a secondary education. For the past 17 years, she and her husband have been actively practicing crop farming and livestock breeding. They started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Currently, Nazira has 3 dairy cows, 2 bull calves, 2 horses and 25 sheep on her farm. She has a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, barley, sainfoin and wheat. Her average monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her farm and crop fields, Nazira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) to cover her hay harvesting expenses. This will allow her to provide her cattle with her own feed and increase her number of cattle in the future.

loans.use: to cover her hay harvesting expenses.

loans.name: Nurzhan

texts.ru: Нуржан 39 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. У Нуржан средне-специальное образование, много лет проработала учителем начальных классов. На сегодняшний день она ведет свое небольшое хозяйство с 1997 года, занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 1 бычок, 5 овец и 1 нетель. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,75 ГА засеянный ячменем. Добрые и хорошие отношения в семье дают хороший результат, а именно на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,500 сом (KGS) преимущественно от реализации молока и молочной продукции местным жителям. Домашнее вкусное молоко пользуется большим спросом, поэтому Нуржан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и намерена накопить средства на свадьбу дочери.
texts.en: Nurzhan is 39 years old, married and has two children. Nurzhan has a secondary-specialized education. She worked for many years as an elementary school teacher. Since 1997, she has been running her own small farm where she practices livestock breeding. She currently has 1 cow, 1 bull calf, 5 sheep and 1 heifer on her farm. She also has a 1.75 hectare plot of land sown with barley. Good family ties produce good results. Specifically, her farm brings in an average monthly income of 8,500 som (KGS), primarily from the sale of milk and dairy products to local residents. There is a big demand for delicious home-cultivated milk which is why Nurzhan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow. Nurzhan plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase the size of her herd. She is also determined to save money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her revenue from selling milk products.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 39 years old and has one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for one year. In the future Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Sriram Group

texts.en:
Mahar community of Balangir district in Odisha, India is known for bamboo crafts. Mahulpada village is remotely located and rural. In this village there is a separate hamlet for the Mahar community. The main source of livelihood for this community is weaving bamboo baskets. In the year 2014, 15 poor, illiterate rural women of this hamlet formed a Self Help Group named Jay Ram with an objective of taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their families with the improvement of their existing business. Basant, age 45, is one of the members who is sitting in the middle with her hand raised. She is married and resides in a small hut with her four-member family comprised of her husband, one son age 17 and one daughter age 12 who are continuing their studies. All members of this group have a very poor background with a lack of all basic needs like education, shelter, health facilities etc.  

The business of Basant is a traditional business of their community (weaving of bamboo baskets). Basant and her husband combined do the processing work and knit baskets of different varieties. They sell their products in the nearest weekly market of the town. Some traders also regularly come to this village to purchase bamboo products. Basant earns a monthly profit of Rs 4,000 from her business. This small income is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenses as well as the educational expenses of her children. As there is a growing demand for these products to supply to various parts of the country, Basant wants to purchase more raw bamboo with this loan of 14,000 INR to work for a longer period. This will help her to earn some extra income to manage the family smoothly. Basant hopes to construct a house in the near future and give a higher education to her son and daughter.

The other 14 members of the group also do the same business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw bamboo.

loans.name: Aitasi

texts.en:
Aitasi is a 41-year-old divorced woman with one child. 

She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Aitasi needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers, and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Aitasi has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers, and new goggles

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Aliitasi needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of flour, a sack of corn, boxes of noodles, a can of coffee, bags of rice, barrel of cooking oil, and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Aliitasi has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of flour, a sack of corn, boxes of noodles, a can of coffee, bags of rice, barrel of cooking oil, and a new oven

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Enkhbaatar, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2010. His wife is a packer at a pharmaceutical company and has been working for six years. Their children began elementary school recently. 

Using his previous loan, he has completed his house-building and created a comfortable living environment. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay the remaining fees for the electric car that he recently bought. 

Compared to other cars, electric cars emit less smoke and wastes less fuel for driving. As the clean air campaign is ongoing under the supervision of the state, people are shifting to more environmentally friendly cars. The borrower is one of the clever people who knows the benefits of electric car.

loans.use: to pay for remaining fee of electic car

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 31 años de edad casada y sin hijos.
Ella es pobladora de la comunidad de “Huayrocondo”, los habitantes del área son agricultores dedicados al comercio de ganado y venta de derivados lácteos.  Su actividad principal es la venta de comida, ella prepara comida a diario y la vende en su puesto fijo de venta. Su marido se ocupa del campo de la construcción como maestro contratista realiza; muros, viviendas, todo tipo de obra gruesa, juntos comparten los gastos y ganancias de ambos negocios. Sonia tiene buenos ingresos en su negocio y encuentra la necesidad de invertir en el negocio de su esposo como la compra de una mezcladora de arena, esta máquina ahorraría tiempo y aceleraría la marcha de la construcción, por eso es necesaria, ganando tiempo de trabajo y el tiempo de sobra lo ocuparía en otra construcción, obteniendo mejores ganancias para su economía.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una maquina mescladora de arena.
texts.en:
Sonia, 31, is married and has no children.  She lives in the community of Huayrocondo, where the residents are farmers who sell cattle and dairy products.

Her main job is selling food.  She prepares food every day to sell in her permanent sales stall.  Her husband works in construction as a master contractor.  He does walls, houses, and all types of rough work.  Together they share the expenses and profits of both businesses.

Sonia earns a good income in her business and finds it necessary to invest in buying a sand mixer for her husband's business.  This machine is necessary because it would save time and accelerate the construction schedule, saving work time to use on other projects and earning better profits for their finances.

This is why Sonia's requesting a loan to buy a sand mixer.

loans.use: to buy a sand mixer

loans.name: Jenson Antonio

texts.es: Jenson tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 meses y 18 meses de edad. Jenson pose una panadería en casa de su propiedad  lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y mantener la economía del hogar. Jenson desea reparar las condiciones habitacinales de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena dado que desea reparar las paredes de su vivienda. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Jenson is 28 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children, 6 months and 18 months old. Jenson owns a bakery in a house on his property, which allows him to earn the daily expenses and support the economy of his home. Jenson wants to repair the living conditions of the house, therefore he asks for this loan through FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement and sand given that he wants to repair the walls of his house. He hopes to be able to have access to this financing and in this way, get started on the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to repair the walls of his home

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: Bashorat is 48-years-old. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. Bashorat is married and has three children. Her children are adults. Bashorat’s husband is a farmer. She has been busy for five years selling food items. She grows fruits and vegetables in the orchard of her house and sells them in her food shop. Her food shop is located near her house that she lives in. Bashorat’s daughter-in-law helps her with managing the business. Bashorat tries to grow high quality fruits and vegetables to attract more customers this way. Bashorat is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers for growing vegetables and fruits. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for growing vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. Rosario is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 43 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc., to sell.

Ma. Cecilia has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc,. to sell

loans.name: Leoi

texts.en: Leoi is 38 years old and married with 7 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. Leoi has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is a farmer residing in a village of Misamis Occidental. To make a living, he used to help his parents operate and manage their own farm. They raise livestock like goats, pigs and cows. Ernest has focused recently on raising goats because of higher market demand. Ernest joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy more livestock to raise. He wants to use the generated income for future emergencies and savings.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is married with two children and resides in Misamis Occidental along with her family. She owns and manages a general store, selling grocery goods and home products in her community to make a living. Zenaida has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC used for her business. Recently, she requested a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the income generated with her loan to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 51-years-old and married with 4 children. She has a small farm where she grows peanuts that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Ana needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She became a member of SPBD this year. Ana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also sells Intra vitamins for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy Intra products like multivitamins for her business. She will also use her loan to buy grocery items for her variety store. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ruth dreams that her business will grow bigger and be well established. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for Intra products like multivitamins for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a fish pond business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her fish.

Teresita has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her fish.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 32-years-old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Arlyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Arlyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Arlyn has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Arlyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn is 52 years old and widowed with five children, two of whom are in school, Lewelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lewelyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Lewelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 42-years-old and married with two children who are in school.  Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lolita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lolita has taken a PHP 9,860 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lolita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past five years, Vernonica has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Veronica wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en: Age 32, Sreymao is a local farmer who grows rice as the main source of income to support her family. She has been involved in her current business for several years. Sreymao is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан 33 года,есть дочь. У Бурмакан среднее образование, она работает в районной больнице, а также с 2010 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурмакан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 корова, 3 овцы и 5 коз. Для животных заготовлены сено и корма, на лето отгоняют на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 6,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коз. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Burmakan is 33 years old and has a daughter. Burmakan has a secondary education. She works in the district hospital. Since 2010, she has been practicing livestock breeding as an additional source of income for her family. She started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Burmakan's hard work, she currently has 1 cow, 3 sheep and 5 goats on her farm. She has harvested hay and feed for her livestock. In the summer, she puts them out to pasture. Her average monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Burmakan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy goats. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Taufao

texts.en: Taufao is a 66-year-old woman with 4 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Taufao needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taufao has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband renders taxi service to local people for living. Davaasuren is currently staying at home due to pregnancy. She and her husband have an idea for launching new business, running a grocery store on their land so that she can work as saleswoman at her grocery store. For this purpose, Davaasuren is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to make an extension to her house. The extension will be used as the grocery store, and through the extension, her family can live in more a spacious place. Also her family will burn less coal for heating and then release less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to enlarge her house and use the extension as a grocery store.

loans.name: Matimtiman

texts.en:
This is Matimtiman, 51, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Bienvenido, a vendor, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household, while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Matimtiman operates a food processing business. She has a factory, a few steps from her house, where they manufacture the meat products. She earns by selling her goods to her neighbors and to suppliers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Matimtiman is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory.

Matimtiman hopes to have her own stall and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional processed and frozen meat products.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
This is Amy, 47, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ramon, a vendor, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Amy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Amy hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ma. Ena

texts.en:
Ma. Ena works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Ma. Ena would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en: Channa is a villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province and she is 40 years old. She is married and blessed with six children. Currently, three of them are still relying on her and one is in school. To overcome her financial burden, she grows rice on three hectares of farmland and has a paid working job for supplementary income. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and it has earned her a decent income to feed the family. This is not the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans successfully and they have enabled her to provide sufficient meals for her kids. Now, she leads a group of two to request a loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and to pay for plowing fees. She strongly hopes to gain a better crop yield and to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru: Наталье 37 лет, имеет 5 детей, младшему из которых 1 год. Наталья в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Натальи в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 15 свиней, ежемесячная прибыль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наталья обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки поросят. Доходы от кредита Наталья планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшее время планирует отремонтировать сарай.
texts.en: Natalia is 37 years old and has five children, the youngest of whom is one year old. As a source of income for her family, Natalia practices livestock breeding. She started this business 13 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Natalia's hard work, she currently has 15 pigs on her farm. Her average monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Natalia turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying piglets. Natalia plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future acquisition of livestock. In the near future, she also plans to repair her barn.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Tavau

texts.en:
Tavau is 43 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells elei (printed material) to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and a new cutter

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more of the products that she needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business assists with their everyday household expenditures. Her husband, who is a construction worker, helps her provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy more balut (fertilized duck eggs), eggs and crackers needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family is always in good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more balut (fertilized duck eggs), eggs and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Gansukh, 33 years old, lives with his mother in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2009.

They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy felts to update the layer of the ger. Extra layering of the ger will enable him to burn less coal for heating and then release less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to buy felts

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, 57 years of age, is married and they're blessed with three children. He has managed a farm in their village for almost thirty years and earned a net income of PHP 60,000 last cropping. His income from his farming business is usually spent on purchasing goats to raise and sell.

Due to insufficient funds from his business, he would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that his farm will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase fertlizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than eleven years and she earns well from this. Being all alone and having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide her children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Marilyn would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 12,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Marilyn hopes for her business to continue growing and expanding. She also dreams for a harmonious relationship with her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Violeta will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Neva Jane

texts.en:
Neva Jane is 32 years old and married and has five children, who are in school.  

Neva Jane and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. Neva Jane is taking out a housing loan amounting to 7,390 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Neva Jane can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Alicia works hard to support her family. She has a seaweed-culture business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Alicia is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings and other materials for her seaweed-culture business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and other materials

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Araceli works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Araceli is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of dried fish to sell for her business buying and selling dried fish.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Humberto un hombre de 57 años de edad el cual realiza actividades agropecuarias junto a su esposa más específicamente enfocado en la producción de leche, actividad que ha realizado toda su vida pues nació y se crio en el campo. 
Siempre se ha querido tener su propio hogar con su campo para tener sus animales pero sus 6 hijos que tuvo a lo largo de su vida le negaron esa posibilidad pues debía mantenerlos y educarlos como padre y hombre responsable que es. 
Hoy en día quiere hacer realidad ese sueño por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de una vaca para aumentar su producción y por ende su capital, buscando mejorar la empresa para acercarse a ese sueño de tener sus propias tierras
texts.en:
Humberto is 57 years old. He makes a living farming with his wife, more specifically focused on milk production. He has been in this business all of his life; he was born and raised in the countryside.
He has always wanted to own his own home with his own fields to keep their animals on, but their 6 children that took over his life and denied that possibility. He raised them and educated them as the father and responsible man he is.
Today he wants to make that dream come true. He is asking for a loan for the purchase of a cow to increase his production and thus his capital. He is seeking to improve his business to come closer to that dream of owning their own land.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,780 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Regina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Pet's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Pet is 50-years-old and a father of five children. For his family, rice farming is the single source of income which he has occupied since he was 30-years-old.  Currently, it earns him about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Including this loan, Pet is an eighth-time borrower who is applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR and joins a group of two with a fourth-time borrower who requests a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his crop. He highly believes that he can improve his living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his crop

loans.name: Sabougnouman 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMAN 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame  SALIMATA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMAN 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 30 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of Sabougnouman 6 Group are married women who are 29 years old on average, have an average of two children, and live for the most part in traditional families in Kapala, a village in the Sikasso cercle [county] in Mali's third administrative region. 

These women work with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to successfully complete their farming during the rainy season. They are on their first seasonal loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

The crop to be grown is ground nuts, [by] Mrs. Salimata, standing in the middle of the photo of Sabougnouman 6 Group. With her loan, Mrs. Salimata plans to purchase 30kg of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and to pay the costs of labor to maintain 0.25 hectares.

After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, to a group of customers made up of men and women, for cash and credit. Mrs. Salimata expects to see an average profit of 36,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana tiene 55 años de edad  y se dedica al comercio de tamales elaborados por ella misma y a la compra y venta de pescado. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho para ganarse el sustento diario. Ana solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de materiales para construir un corredor a la vivienda dado que cuando llueve el agua se filtra y daña sus pocas pertenencias. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
Ana, 55, earns a living selling tamales she makes herself and buying and selling fish.  She's a very hardworking woman who makes a big effort to earn her daily living.

Ana's asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in buying materials to build a porch on her house.  When it rains, water seeps in and damages the few belongings she has.

With the amount requested she'll buy cement, sand, galvanized metal, and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized metal, and wood

loans.name: Armelyn

texts.en:
Armelyn is 36 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Armelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Armelyn has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy is the mother of three dependent children; one is too young for school and two are in school. She is one of the breadwinners in her family and strives for a living through rice farming on two hectares and through working as a paid worker. Her business, which she has done for 15 years, currently earns her about 31,000 KHR. 

Channy, who is in her sixth loan cycle and has successfully repaid past loans, which have gradually improved her lifestyle, has formed a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay labor costs. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield from her crop than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Nelvi Marion

texts.es: La señora Nelvi de 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive en Cochabamba con sus padres, tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel profesional, es contadora de profesión y no tiene hijos que dependan de su ingreso. Su principal actividad es el servicio de asesor de créditos, con una antigüedad de 1 año en el rubro, el presente crédito es para la compra de una computadora portátil, porque la que tenía le robaron por su barrio, por esa razón es urgente que realice la compra porque necesita trabajar en ella y actualmente  no cuenta con los medios necesarios para comprarse una nueva computadora, con esta herramienta podrá continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelvi is 25 years old, single, and lives in Cochabamba with her parents. She has a professional-level education. Nelvi is an accountant by profession and has no children who are dependent on her income. Her main business activity is providing credit counseling services, a field in which she has one year of experience.

This current loan will be used to buy a laptop computer because she the one she had got stolen in her neighborhood. For this reason, it is urgent that she buy a computer because she needs it for her work. Nelvi does not have the necessary funds at the moment to buy a new computer, which will allow her to continue in her work.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for her work.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mona still hopes for success both in business and life. She desires sufficiency and continuous provision for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 39 años de edad soltera y madre de una hija.
Su hija está comenzando a estudiar en la escuela secundaria, durante las mañanas colabora con las labores de su madre. La actividad principal de Ana es la venta de desayuno, ella se encarga de preparar diferentes tipos de desayuno y su hija se encarga de la entrega, sus clientes mayormente son personas que trabajan en oficinas o en horarios continuos, también tiene un puesto a la calle donde sirve el desayuno de manera directa. Ana tiene necesidades básicas de refacción de vivienda, a ella le gustaría que su hija viva en una vivienda mejor cuidada, su vivienda cuenta con muchas grietas y goteras debido al cambio de clima y a la falta de refacción. Ana desea mejorar su calidad de vida para su hija.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su domicilio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en:
Ana is a 39 year old single mother with one daughter.
Her daughter is starting high school, in the mornings she works with her mother. Ana's main business is selling breakfast. She is responsible for preparing different types of breakfast and daughter takes care of the delivery. Her customers are mostly people who work in offices or very long hours. She also has a stall on the street where breakfast is served directly. Ana needs basic home repairs; she would like her daughter to live in a better maintained home. Her house has many cracks and leaks due to changes in the climate and lack of repair. Ana wants to improve their quality of life for her daughter.
It is for these reasons that Ana is requesting a loan for renovation of her home to improve the quality of life of her daughter.

loans.use: to renovate her home to improve the quality of life of her daughter.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 59 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Belen has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Chelyn

texts.en:
Chelyn is 26 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and piglets to raise.

Chelyn has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Phoeurn, a mother of 12 children, is 50 years old and a local villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. 

She struggles to make a living for the sake of her big family via rice cropping as the main source of her income which generates her about 40,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Phoeurn and the second loan for her joint borrower in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The positive impact of her loans has enabled her to improve her lifestyle gradually. For this cycle, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn, age 37, earns a living by raising pigs. She has been engaged in this activity for five years. She also earns an additional income from food vending. 

Emelyn lives with her husband and their three children in Palawan.
 
She is requesting PhP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to be able afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aytbyubi

texts.ru: Айтбюби, 57 лет, есть сын. Айтбюби с 2009 года занимается торговлей, она продает молочную продукцию (курут, сузмо, топленное масло) и мед на центральном рынке города. Благодаря упорному труду, ее товарооборот увеличился до 80,000 сом (KGS) - это 4 бочки меда, 100 литров топленного масла, 100 килограммов курута. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS).
