В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айтбюби обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является заготовка молочной продукции и меда для дальнейшей перепродажи. Товары натуральные и пользуются большим спросом. Доходы от кредита Айтбюби планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, и мечтает дать своему сну достойное будущее.
texts.en: Aytbyubi is 57 years old and has a son. Since 2009, Aitbyubi has been working in retail. She sells dairy products (kurut or dried sour cream, suzmo or sour cottage cheese, and clarified butter) and honey at the city's central market. Thanks to her hard work, her sales volume has increased to 80,000 som (KGS) - that is 4 barrels of honey, 100 liters of clarified butter, and 100 kilograms of kurut. Her average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Aytbyubi turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to procure dairy products and honey for future retail sale. There is always a large demand for her all-natural merchandise. Aytbyubi plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business. She also dreams of giving her son a promising future.

loans.use: to buy more dairy products and honey to increase her sales turnover.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su hijo de 20 años de edad y su hija de 15 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Amparo trabaja en una empresa cercana a su localidad y además, elabora pupusas para la venta. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su integridad. Amparo solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del techo y del piso de la vivienda por lo que comprará cemento, arena,grava y teja.
texts.en:
Amparo is 50 years old and resides in her own home along with her 20-year-old son and 15-year-old daughter who is in school. She works at a company near her town, but she also prepares and sells “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings). Amparo is a hardworking woman who has received good references from several people because of her integrity.

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in improvements to the roof and floor of her home. For this reason, Amparo will buy cement, sand, gravel, and tiles.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing the roof and floor of her home.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, age 56, is a rice farmer. She has managed her small farm for almost 34 years. She earned a net income of PHP 150,000 last cropping.

Merlita's husband works as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They are blessed with four children. 

Due to lack of capital for use in her agricultural business, Merlita would like to access a loan amounting to PhP 50,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm. 

She hopes that her rice farm will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more income with which to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era, age 40, buys and sells nipa roofing materials to earn an income. She has operated this business for the past year. She also earns an additional income from raising pigs.

Era and her husband have five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

Era has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested a new loan in the amount of PhP 11,000 through NWTF in order to purchase a stock of nipa roofing materials to offer for sale.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of nipa roofing materials to offer for sale

loans.name: Abigail Del Carmen

texts.es:
Abigail de 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, debido a que sus padres no tenían los recursos necesarios para estudiar; está casada y su esposo es agente de seguridad, tienen 3 hijos y solo una vive en casa y estudia cuarto año en la universidad, viven 3 sobrinas y un nieto
La mayor parte de su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar, hace ocho años dejo de trabajar en un comedor, razones porque está a cargo de cuidar a sus sobrinas y un nieto, el trabajo lo realiza en casa todos los días.
El préstamo que está solicitando es para reparar el pozo de su casa, ya que se le seco y le urge hacerlo más profundo, y mejorar sus condiciones de vida porque va a satisfacer y realizar las funciones del vital líquido.
El sueño próximo que tiene es ver graduarse a su hija de contaduría pública, en un futuro desea trabajar nuevamente en el comedor de antes para aportar ingresos al hogar.
texts.en:
Abigail is a 43 year-old who did not have the opportunity to go to school because her parents didn’t have the resources to send her. Her husband is a security officer, and she has 3 children, one of whom still lives at home and is in the fourth year of university. She also lives with three of her nieces and one grandchild. She used to work at a restaurant, but quit eight years ago because she had to take care of her nieces and grandson. When not working at the restaurant, she spends her time doing household chores.

She is requesting a loan to repair the well in her home, which is dry. She wants to make it deeper, which will improve her living conditions and provide her family with the necessary water.

Her dream is to see her daughter graduate from public accounting school, and in the future she would like to work in the restaurant again to contribute to the household income.

loans.use: to repair the well for her home.

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en:
Koeurn is 37 years old and a local farmer who strives for a living with rice cropping, the only source of family’s income. She has four children, three of whom still count on her as they are in school.  

This is the fifth loan for Koeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she teams up a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. 

She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before so that she can make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang, 57 and the mother of two children, is a resident of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Her main sources of income are three hectares of rice farming and a dessert-selling business. Her 31 years of engagement allow her to generate a decent income to support her household, around 41,000 KHR (Cambodia Riel). 

This is the first microloan for Hang and her co-borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Hang will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for plowing. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before so that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
Муборак умная, воспитанная и приятная в общении женщина. Ей 48 лет. Она с семьей проживает на районе Спитамен вблизи городка Худжанд. Она замужем. Ее мужу 49 лет. Она работает на почте. У них двое детей. Сыну 27 лет, он находиться в Российской Федерации. Дочке 25 лет.
 Муборак около 9 лет занимается купле продажей скотин. Ухаживать, кормить и поить скотин она научилась еще в родительском доме. И 9 лет назад она решила свои навыки и опыт использовать в малом бизнесе. Муборак покупает теленка, откармливает его и после длительного времени продает их. Таким образом, она помогает семейному бюджету.
На данный момент она просит кредит, чтобы купить больше телят и бычков для увеличения поголовья скотин и расширить бизнес.
texts.en:
Murborak is an intelligent, well-raised and pleasant woman. She is 48 years old. She and her family live in the Spitamen District, close to the city of Khujand. She is married. Her husband is 49 years old. She works at a post office. She and her husband have two children. Their son is 27 years old and he works and resides in the Russian Federation. Their daughter is 25 years old.

Muborak has been buying and selling cattle for around 9 years. She learned how to learned how to look after, feed and water cattle from her parents as a small child. Nine years ago, she decided to use her skills and experience to open her own small business. Muborak will buy a calf, fatten it up and then, after some time, will re-sell it. In this way she contributes to the family budget.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy more calves and bull-calves to increase the size of her herd and expand her business.

loans.use: to increase the size of her herd and expand her business.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият жительница города Куляб, Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ей 49 лет. По специальности она медсестра. У нее имеется опыт в этой области. Из-за состояния здоровья она не может работать по специальности. Сутками работать ей очень тяжело. Хосият недавно начала шить национальные платья. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки. У нее имеется старая машинка, которая выходит из строя и Хосият приходится часто чинить машинку. С этой швейной машинкой у нее много затрат.
texts.en: Khosiyat is a resident of the city of Kulob, in the Khatlon District of Tajikistan. She is 49 years old. She is a nurse by profession. She has experience in this field of work. Due to her health condition, she is unable to work as a nurse. It's very difficult for her to work round the clock. Not long ago, Khosiyat began sewing ethnic Tajik dresses. She is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She has an old sewing machine, which is breaking down. Khosiyat has to frequently repair this machine. This machine has cost her a lot of expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por sus cinco hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos maíz y frijol y adicional a eso trabaja de jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar las necesidades de su hogar,  Marco solicita un crédito para comprar herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y también mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco is 53 years old and lives in his own home with his family consisting of his five children. He makes a living growing basic grains like corn and beans and in addition to this he works as a day laborer in an estate close to his home. His earnings help to cover household necessities.

Marco is requesting this loan to buy herbicides, manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and also to improve the land shown in the photograph. In this way he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc and also to improve the land.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 63 years old, married and has six grown children. An active borrower with a strong determination to succeed, she has diversified from a hog-raising business into a vegetable stand. 

Isabel is now requesting a loan of P23,000 to buy eggplant, tomatoes, beans and bananas to sell. Selling more merchandise will help increase her sales and income. Isabel hopes to continue generating good income from her vegetable stand and achieve income stability.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, beans and bananas to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma operates a nipa roof-making business to earn an income. She weaves nipa palm fronds to make mats used for thatching. She has been engaged in this business for one year. She earns an additional income from buying and selling bananas. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Erna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase such items as nipa leaves and bamboo for her roof-making business.

She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase such items as nipa leaves and bamboo for her roof-making business

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto de 60 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, por motivos económicos de sus padres.  Está soltero y tiene tres hijos, que ya formaron su familia, él vive con su madre, una hermana y una sobrina.
Desde pequeño se dedica a la agricultura y aprendió ya que su padre se lo llevaba a trabajar, a sembrar maíz, arroz, y frijol; actualmente sembrara 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de frijol, el terreno esta a unos 30 minutos de su casa y se va caminando.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas, ya que sembrara 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de frijol.
El sueño del cliente en un futuro es tener ganado propio, con las ganancias de la siembra de maíz y del frijol ira ahorrando para cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 60 years old. Because his parents did not have the economic means, he did not have the opportunity to study. He is single and has three children who now have their own families. He lives with his mother, his sister and his niece. 

Since he was little, he has made a living in agriculture. He learned to plant corn, rice and beans from his father, who took him to work with him. He currently plants 10,500 square meters of corn and 7,000 of beans. The plot is about 30 minutes from his house and he walks there.

The loan he is requesting is to purchase compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides, since he will plant 10,500 square meters of corn and 7,000 of beans.

This client’s dream is to have his own livestock. With the profits from sowing corn and beans he will save up to realize his dream.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides, since he will plant 10,500 square meters of corn and 7,000 of beans.

loans.name: Tali

texts.en: Tali is a 55-year-old married mother of six who has been making and selling Samoan cocoa in her community for five years to earn a living. Tali needs a loan to buy 10 bags of cocoa beans, a large iron tool for pounding cocoa, plastic bags, foam cups and a small cooler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tali has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of cocoa beans, a large iron tool for pounding cocoa, plastic bags, foam cups and a small cooler

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee, a 24-year-old mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. For two years she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from fishing.

Imee, who has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 28000 to buy more items to sell such as soap, sardines, sugar, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, sardines, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Мадина. Ей 25 лет. Она живет вместе с мамой и братом в городе Худжанд. Мадина занимается кройкой и шитьем национальной и европейской одежды. Она берет заказы на дому. Мадина умелая швея и постепенно количество клиентов увеличиваются. Мама Мадины работает в "Таджик стандарте". Младшему брату 19 лет, его зовут Дододжон. Он учиться в Государственном Университете Политики и Бизнеса города Худжанд в экономическом факультете на первом курсе. Он хочет получить высшее образование и устроиться на работу по специальности, чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи. На сегодняшний день это является основной целью в жизни Дододжона.
   Обучение в Университете является платным, к сожалению, на следующий учебный семья не сможет оплатить учебный год Дододжона. Мадина надеется получить кредит, чтобы Дододжон смог продолжить учебу. Она верит и надеется, что ее брат закончит Университет и получит достойную работу.
texts.en:
This woman's name is Madina. She is 25 years old. She lives with her mother and brother in the city of Khujand. Madina cuts patterns for and sews ethnic Tajik and European clothes. She takes orders from her home. Madina is a talented seamstress and gradually her number of customers has increased. Madina's mother works for a Tajik Certification and Regulatory Compliance Agency. Her younger brother, Dodojon, is 19 years old. He attends Tajik State University of Politics and Business, which is located in the city of Khujand. He is a first-year student in the Economics Department. He wants to receive a university education and land a job in his field of study in order to improve the financial situation of his family. This is currently Dodojon's main goal in life.

This university education is not free and unfortunately, Dodojon's family cannot pay for the next year's tuition. Madina wants to receive a loan for that Dodojon can continue his studies. She believes and hopes that her brother will graduate from university and get a good job.

loans.use: to pay her younger brother's university tuition.

loans.name: Confianza Y Dignidad 1 Group

texts.en:
Eridania is a member of the Confianza y Dignidad (Truth and Dignity) 1 loan group. The members of this group are micro-entrepreneurs who make a living by selling clothing, assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. They sell their items in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the country's northeast. She lives in a simple home with her long-term partner and their two children. Her most difficult challenges have been to establish her business and to be sustainable.

Eridania is very excited about receiving her eleventh loan from Esperanza Internacional, and has repaid her previous loans satisfactorily after using them to expand her business. She has had her business for almost eight years, and has been taking out loans from Esperanza for about six years. She will use this new loan to buy more cacao and equipment that will allow her to produce more milled cocoa. She will reinvest the profits in her business and set aside some money as savings. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cacao and equipment to produce Cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Ada Astrid

texts.es: Ada de 50 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con su hijo, ella tiene una tienda en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Ada solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería por mayor como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, sopas, cafe, etc. para surtir su negocio,  y asi poder tener junto con su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ada, 50, lives in her family home with her son. She has a shop in her place of residence. She has a lot of customers due to the variety of products she sells and because of the good prices. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the necessities of her home. Ada is requesting a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale such as candies, drinks, basic grains, soups, coffee, etc. to stock her shop and thus be able to have, along with her son, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, drinks, basic grains, soups, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Marina Aleyda

texts.es: Marina de 33 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos dos varones de 8 y 5 años y una niña de 1 año de edad. Ella se dedica a la piscicultura específicamente a la cría de tilapia junto a su compañero de vida siendo muy conocidos por ser personas emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras. Ella esta solicitando este crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de su vivienda que están hechas de adobe por lo que son bastante propensas a la anidación de plagas, lo que es un riesgo para la salud de su familia.
texts.en: Marina, 33, lives with her partner and their three children, two boys who are 8 and 5 and one girl who is 1 years old. She is dedicated to fish farming, specifically raising tilapia alongside her partner. They are well known for being enterprising and very hard working people.  She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy cement and sand to repair the walls of her house that are made of adobe which makes them quite prone to nesting pests, which is a risk for the health of her family.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is 30 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc. Leah has been in this business for three years. In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 3 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group, Unidas para Triunfar (Unite to win) 3. This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Ramona is the mother of two children and makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. 

Ramona is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza and by the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She is running a hot dog cart in front of her house where she sells the food for dinnertime. Ramona will use this loan to purchase bread, sausages, soda, ketchup, and other ingredients to make the food taste delicious. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to support her family’s needs. She thanks all of you for your support

loans.use: to buy sausages, bread, mayonnaise, soda, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Estela

texts.es: Sandra de 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo y su hija, ella posee un molino desde hace varios años y adicional a eso también tiene una pequeña tienda, tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas ya que ella es una persona muy amable y responsable, Sandra  solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Sandra, 54, lives in her own house with her family made up of her husband and daughter. She has had a mill for many years and in addition to this, also has a small shop. She has a lot of customers, mainly women who make tortillas and come to grind the corn to make them since she is a very friendly and responsible person. Sandra is requesting a loan to be able to buy blades, discs and all the necessary tools to have a good mill and thus continue with her work to give daily support to her family without limitation.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs and all the necessary tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand in order to make improvements to the bedrooms in her home.

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es: Ana de 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de medicinas y productos de uso personal desde hace varios años,  vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar las necesidades de su hogar,  Ana solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayo como: perfumes, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, medicina, etc.  y asi poder tener junto con su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 52 years old, lives in her own house with her son who works and helps her financially. She has been dedicated to selling medicines and personal use products for many years. She sells on foot in the different areas that are found near her place of residence. With what she earns from her sales, she helps pay for the necessities of her home. Ana requests a loan to buy more products at wholesale such as perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, medicines, etc. and thus be able to have, along with her son, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products at wholesale such as perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, medicines, etc.

loans.name: Jagadamba Group

texts.en:
The village Tetelkhunti is a remotely located rural village of the Balangir district of Odisha, India.This village hails in one of the underdeveloped region of Odisha state. The main source of income of the people of this village is from cultivation and micro enterprises. 

Tilottama, a lady of 23 years, lives here with her husband and one daughter of 3 years in a small mud house. She is third from right with her hand raised in the photograph. Her family belongs to the below poverty line category. Tilottama, with the help of her husband, has been running a general store in her house for the last 5 years, selling varieties of items like potatoes, oil, rice, dough, soap, sugar, tea, washing powder, lentils, biscuits, toffees, eggs, stationery items, and mobile recharge vouchers. Initially she started this business with a small investment of her own. She purchases stock for her business thrice a week from the wholesale sellers of the nearest town, which is 15 kms away. Due to a lack of sufficient money, she has to purchase items on a regular basis, which unnecessarily increases costs in both finance and labor. From her business, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 Indian rupees (INR), on which it is very hard for her to manage her family. 

To expand her business for more income in the year 2014, Tilottama, along with other ten women of her village, formed a self help group named Jagadamba to receive a loan from the Mahashakti foundation. She wants to increase stock of products for her business from her portion of the loan in the amount of 14,000 INR by purchasing items like potato, lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc. Tilottama hopes this will help her to increase her income for materializing her dreams of construction of a house, a toilet and better education of her daughter.
	
The other ten borrowers of the group are doing micro enterprises such as fast food centers, dry food and spices businesses, puffed rice selling, rice selling, daily needs shop, general store, bold gram fry and selling, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing potato, lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 40 years old and married, with two children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like soap, sardines, and sugar.

Leny has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Leny aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, sardines, and sugar.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia de 23 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijas de 8 y 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombre,niño y para mujer como: pantalones, camisas, short, blusas, faldas, etc. Desde hace mucho tiempo  se traslada a diferentes zonas de su localidad  para ofrecer sus productos de forma ambulante.  Cecilia solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para reparar el techo de dos cuartos de su vivienda, para lo que necesitará comprar lamina galvanizada y madera  para reparar el techo y así proteger sus pertenencias  y familia de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 23 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her two daughters, who are 8 and 3 years old. She earns her living selling clothing for men, women, and children, including pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, and skirts. For a long time, she has traveled to different parts of her town to offer her products for sale on the streets. 

Cecilia is requesting a loan from FUSAI to repair the roof of two of the bedrooms of her house. She will need to buy galvanized metal and wood to repair the roof in order to protect her belongings and her family from the rain.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting and wood to repair the roof over two bedrooms in her house.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa quien trabaja vendiendo tortillas, el se dedica a la venta de pan dulce lo hace de forma ambulante, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposa logran solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Jorge solicita un crédito para la compra de pan dulce por mayor y así poder tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his wife, who sells tortillas. He sells sweet bread as a street vendor.  With what he gets from his sales, and with his wife's help, they manage to pay for some of their household needs.

Jorge is requesting a loan to buy sweet bread at wholesale, so that he and his wife can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sweet bread at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, gravel and sand to construct walls for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy furniture.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married and has three children. Her spouse is a tricycle driver, offering transport services to the people in their village. Daily income goes for meals and revolving capital in the business. 

Marivic would like to continue operating a good transport business, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy gasoline and crude oil and to pay for maintenance of the motorcycle. It will help her husband to offer safe travel to all their passengers. 

Someday, Marivic hopes to gain good profits for her family’s future expenses.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil and to pay for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Lorraine

texts.en: Lorraine is 42 years old and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a pig raising business in the Philippines. Lorraine has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins to sell. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorraine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store and pig fattening businesses in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Marilyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma is 45 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, noodles, etc. Lerma has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing. Lerma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Nhoeurn is a rice farmer. Her primary source of income is her two hectares of farmland, where she strives for a living by planting and harvesting rice. This business currently earns her about 31,000 KHR per day. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years.

Nhoeurn is in her late 40s and is the mother of 11 children. The family lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. 

She has fully and successfully repaid her past loan, and it has enabled her to upgrade her family's living conditions. She is now the group leader of three borrowers, each of whom is requesting a loan. This is Nhoeurn's third loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and pesticide for her rice crop. She is hopeful that she will gain a better yield than she was able to harvest in the past.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and pesticide for her rice crop

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is 42 years old and has four children.  Her husband owns a general store and she looks after her children.  Her husband has been running this business for the last three years.  Recently her husband decided to increase sales by purchasing more stock.  But, the problem is that her husband does not have sufficient savings and income to purchase additional items to stock.  All his income is spent fulfilling the monthly expenses.  To meet the cash shortage, she is applying for this loan to help her husband purchase a wider variety of items to stock. 

Ruqiya feels happy to help her husband and thanks Kiva for enabling her to provide support for her husband and her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to stock her husband's general store.

loans.name: Eva Marina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Eva, tiene 65 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tuvo siete hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una de ellos.
Doña Eva es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, desodorantes entre otras cosas más,  tiene  un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende sus productos y también sale a ofrecer por la localidad a vecinos y conocidos a quienes les deja a crédito y les cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos y ahora le sirven para mantenerse ella sola.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes, desodorantes y todo de lo que ella vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Jesús de Nazareth loan group meets twice monthly in the 15 of April neighbourhood in Manta, a town known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year, and for its unequalled beauty and many tourist attractions.

65- year old Sra. Eva makes her home here. She is separated but has seven adult children who have left home, although one daughter still lives with her. Sra. Eva has always worked hard in order to get on in life. She sells all types of clothing, perfume, deodorants etc. from her house as well as in the community to neighbours and acquaintances. She sells the items on credit and then collects money each week. Eva has had her business for more than ten years; with the income she raised her children and now only has herself to support.

She is going to use the loan money to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, perfume, deodorants, and everything else she sells. Eva has been part of this group since the beginning, and she enjoys it because of the help she's received. Her hope for the future is to stay healthy and to make progress.

loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, shirts, perfume, deodorant etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest controls, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 47 years old.  She is married and has four children.  She is both a vendor and a manufacturer of knives in her village.  Together with her spouse, she makes knives of different sizes to sell.  She wants to improve their output and is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy more metals to use in their blacksmith business.  She hopes to keep improving her business and to save money for her family’s future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more metals to use in her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Maria Villa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maria Villa works hard to support her family. She has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, and other materials for her cultured seaweeds business.

Maria Villa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 53 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Merlina has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma de 35 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijas de las edades de 17, 15 y 5 años y un hijo de 12 años, ella está acompañada vive junto a su esposo que se dedica a los trabajos de estructuras metálicas en su casa, comenta que solo estudio hasta cuarto grado pues sus padres no contaban con el dinero suficiente para financiarle los estudios y se pudiera preparar profesionalmente, es por esta razón que Vilma no quiere que sus hijas pasen lo mismo que le paso a ella, pues ella envía a  sus hijas a la escuela pues desea que sus hijos sean profesionales en el futuro.

Vilma se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y cuidar de sus hijos y su esposo en casa, ella cuando todavía no estaba acompañada trabajaba en una empresa de calzado pues no tenía obligaciones de nadie, pero hoy que ya está casada y tiene hijos ella ve la vida con más responsabilidad, la única actividad que le genera ingresos es la venta de productos por catálogo pues ella ve que es una forma de trabajar y lo mejor que no le toma mucho tiempo.

La inversión del crédito será para la remodelación de la vivienda, pues esta época lluviosa le perjudica a su familia, porque se le mojan algunas pertenencias, específicamente construirá dos habitaciones para sus hijas pues ella necesitan privacidad, comprara 1000 bloques,  20 bolsas de cemento,  3 quintales de hierro y la mano de obra, gracias a este proyecto sus hijas e hijo vivirán más cómodamente, más seguros y sin peligro de mojarse cuando llueva.
 

En un futuro tiene varios planes y deseos para ella y su familia, comenta en primer lugar estar en paz con Dios, seguir remodelando su casa y construyendo, que sus hijas estudien mucho, no como ella que sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar y también a ella le gusta y puede hacer pasteles gracias a un curso que saco, desea poner su propio local de pastelería pues es un proyecto que desea realizarlo con la ayuda de un financiamiento de un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Vilma, 35, is mother to 3 daughters whose ages are 17, 15 and 5 and to one son who is 12. She is married and lives with her husband who is dedicated to metal structure work in their home. She tells us that she finished fourth grade since her parents did not have sufficient money to pay for her education and she could not prepare herself professionally. For this reason, Vilma does not want her children to experience the same that happened to her so she sent her daughters to school and wishes her children to become professionals in the future.

Vilma is dedicated to domestic work and takes care of her children and her husband at home. When she was not yet married, she worked in a shoe factory since she had no obligations. However today, since she is married and has children, she sees life with more responsibility. The only activity that generates income for her is selling catalog products so she sees it as a form of working and, even better, it does not take up much of her time.

The loan investment will be for the remodeling of her house since during the rainy season her family is harmed since some of their belongings get wet. Specifically, she will build two rooms for her daughters since they need privacy. She will buy 1000 blocks, 20 bags of cement, 3 quintals of irons and workers. Thanks to this project, her children will live more comfortably, more securely and without danger of getting wet when it rains.

In the future, she has many plans and desires for herself and her family. She tells us that in first place is to be at peace with God, to keep remodeling and building her house, that her daughters study a lot unlike her since her parents could not give her the opportunity to study and also, she would like to be able to make pastries thanks to a course she took. She wishes to start her own pastry shop since it is a project that she wishes to start with the help of a new loan.

loans.use: to buy 1000 blocks, 20 bags of cement, 3 quintals of iron and workers to build two rooms.

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus seis hijos de los cuales dos están trabajando y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas y con la ayuda de sus dos hijos logran solventar los gasto que se le presentan en su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  verdura y fruta por mayor y asi tener junto con sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her six children. Two of them are working and help her with household expenses. She works selling fruits and vegetables in a market located near her home. What she makes from her sales, along with what two of her children contribute, allow her to cover the expenses that arise in her household. 

María is requesting this loan to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables in order to have more financial stability for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mardoqueo

texts.es: Mardoqueo de 52 años de edad esta casado y vive con su esposa y 6 hijos de 11, 13, 15, 16, 19, 24 años de edad los cuales ha sacado adelante junto a su esposa por medio de la agricultura, ya que el cultiva maíz, maicillo, pepino, tomate y frijol  en un terreno que alquila desde hace 30 años. Mardoqueo tiene la necesidad de recolectar agua en su vivienda, por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para construir una pila grande y un baño para lo que comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava,hierro y pagará mano de obra.
texts.en: Mardoqueo, 52, is married and lives with his wife and six children aged 11, 13, 15, 16, 19, and 24 years. He and his wife have supported his family through agriculture, growing corn, sorghum, cucumber, tomatoes, and beans on land they have rented for 30 years. Mardoqueo needs running water in his home so he sought this loan from FUSAI to build a basin and a bathroom. He will buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, steel, and pay laborers.

loans.use: to bring running water into his home

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PH through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.  Regina successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Regina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Merlinda works hard to support her family. She has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings for her cultured seaweeds business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nieva works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fish net, gasoline, and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Nieva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish net, gasoline and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is 55 years old and a local farmer from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province who tackles her family’s hardship by raising rice crops and planting vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Ny, who has previously taken out six loans, has formed a group of two with a fourth-time borrower in order to obtain a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid her previous loans and her living conditions are getting better.  As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy insecticide, to pay the fee for hired labor, to pay the reaping cost and to buy cassava seedlings for her crop. 

She believes that she can gain a good yield, increasing her harvest over previous ones.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, pay labor fees and purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides etc

loans.name: Ángela Fabiola

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret  se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 63 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene ocho hijos  mayores de edad, con ella están tres de ellos.
Doña Ángela es una mujer que a pesar de su edad le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante sola, ella en las mañanas se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas en un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad, pero ya en las tardes y noches instala un pequeño comedor en su casa donde vende caldo de salchichas y salchichas acompañadas de verde asado el cual es la delicia de sus clientes, también prepara meriendas, en este negocio de comida le ayuda una de sus hijas a quien le paga por su ayuda, tiene su comedor 10  años y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, salchichas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva más de 13 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.  Sus metas son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The loan group Jesús De Nazaret  [Jesus of Nazareth] meets every fifteen days in the 15 de Abril neighborhood in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in all seasons. Manta is known for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Angela, 63, lives here in Manta. She is separated and has eight grown children. Three of them live with her. 

Angela is a woman who, despite her age, likes to work and get by independently. In the morning, she sells newspapers and magazines in a small stall in the city center. In the evenings and into the night, she coverts a room of her home into a small restaurant where she sells sausage soup and sausages accompanied by grilled green plantains that delight her customers. She also prepares snacks in the food business. One of her daughters helps her and Angela pays her for her work. She has had her restaurant for 10 years and has always done well as her customers prefer it after they try her dishes. 
Her loan will be used to buy rice, meat, sausages, and other food for her to prepare. She has been involved in this credit group for over 13 years and likes it because one of her loans started this business. Her goals are to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sausages, and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly owns and operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for almost 25 years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by operating her own transportation business. She has a unit of taxi, jeepney, and tricycle.

For these businesses, she would like to take a new loan to improve her service. She is requesting an amount of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more beauty and hair products like straightening treatment and others needed in her business. A portion of the loan will also be used for the maintenance of her transportation vehicles.

In the future, Nelly wants to make improvements in her business and likewise add more transportation units. She also dreams that her children will be open-minded and be properly orientated on putting and growing their own. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the beauty products and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell for her buy and sell fruit and vegetable business.

Perla has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additonal stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona, age 52, prepares and sells dried fish to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ramona requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more fish to dry and offer for sale.

In the future, Ramona would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to dry and offer for sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 41 years old, married, and helps her husband earn for a living. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Rebecca has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sindy Maritza

texts.es:
Sindy es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Palpa junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos quienes son su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un pequeño puesto que hay dentro del mercado y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y siempre atiende con mucho respeto y educación a los clientes.
Sindy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse un celular, de esta manera se mantendrá comunicada cuando trabaje y deje a sus hijos al cuidado de su mamá. Gracias a esto sentirá mayor tranquilidad y seguirá esforzándose para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Sindy is an enterprising young woman. She is 21 years old and lives in Palpa with her family. 
She is a single mother and has two children who are her biggest source of motivation. 
She has been working for several years as an assistant in a small kitchen inside the market. Everything is going well for her because she is responsible, hard working, honest and always attends her customers politely and respectfully. 
Sindy is thankful for the lenders at Kiva because it is through their support that she will be able to purchase a cell phone. Having a cell phone will help her stay in contact with her children and mother when she is at work. She will feel more at ease being able to contact her family when she needs to. She will also continue working hard to make sure her family gets ahead.

loans.use: purchase a cell phone.

loans.name: Auxiliadora Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Auxiliadora, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y de 8 meses el menor, el mayor  estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en el Municipio local y vende pescado. 
Doña Auxiliadora es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y con su esfuerzo  ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado y camarón, con su marido se desplazan a las playas de la localidad a comprar el mejor pescado para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes y también salen a entregar en ciertos restaurantes de la zona, llevan más 2 años con este negocio con el cual se gana algo por el bien familiar.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y camarón. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten aumentar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group Jesús De Nazaret  [Jesus of Nazareth] meets every fifteen days in the 15 de Abril neighborhood in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in all seasons. Manta is known for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions. 
Auxiliadora lives here in Manta. She is 26 years old and lives in a common law relationship with two children, one aged 6 years and an 8-month-old. Her son is in school. Her common-law husband works in the local municipality selling fish. Auxiliadora is a woman who always liked to work and puts in a lot of effort in helping her husband raise their family. She purchases and sells fish and shrimp with her husband on the beaches of the town. She buys the best fish and then distributes it to her customers. She also delivers to certain restaurants in the area. She has done this business for 2 years which earns something good for her family.
The loan will be used to buy fish and shrimp. She has been in this credit group for 4 years and likes it because the loans help her increase her business. He dreams are to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrimp

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado de su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de elotes, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, Orlando esta  solicitando un crédito para invertir en el cultivo del maíz comprando fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
50-year old Orlando lives in his own house with his wife and children. He earns his living growing maize. When the harvest is ready, he sells it locally, and the money he receives helps him pay for household necessities. 

Orlando is seeking a loan to invest in his farm. He wishes to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticide etc. Then he will be able to provide his family with a more stable financial future.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, manure, pesticide etc.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Rosanna is 50 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Rosanna is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks. Rosanna has been raising ducks for eleven years and also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cultured seaweeds business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings for her cultured seaweeds business.

Rocelyn has been in this business for five years. She also earns income from fishing. Rocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Vit's Group

texts.en:
A father of eight children and in his early 50s, Vit is also a local resident who secures the basics for his family via rice farming as the main source of income for his entire household. He can earn extra income via paid working jobs and as a motor-taxi driver. 

Vit has been with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) for the past six cycles with a successful repayment of his past loan. He has fully repaid back his past loan, which enabled him to uplift his lifestyle gradually. Now, he forms a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crop. He hopes that he can make triple income so that he can expand his business in a larger scale than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crops.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 49 years old, married, and has four children.  She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosario has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for a distance learning course.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for seven years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income with the help of her husband.

In relation to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy greater quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

Angelita only hopes to always be healthy. In the future, she wants to give her children a better life and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 72 years old and a widow with ten children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nenita has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 58 years old and married with seven children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a food stall.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
This is Mejumaa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan, this time to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. Her profits from business will definitely help her to afford her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Nuriye

texts.en:
Nuriye has a beauty parlor.  She used to have a hairdresser as a partner, but they came to have disagreements. They split up and Nuriye opened her own shop. With the loan from Maya, she’ll buy products for her shop. By buying wholesale, she’ll be able to buy greater quantities. Nuriye is hardworking and determined.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nuriye Hanım’ın güzellik merkezi var.  Daha önce bir kuaförle ortak çalışıyorlardı fakat zamanla ortağı ile anlaşamamaya başladı.  Ortaklıktan ayrıldı ve kendisine kuaför dükkan açtı.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile dükkanına malzeme alacak.  Malzemeleri toplu alınca daha çok ürün alabiliyor.  Nuriye Hanım,çalışkan ve azimli.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop

loans.name: Fisun

texts.en:
Fisun sells children’s underwear, pajamas, nightgowns, etc. She sells from her house and by walking around. She’ll buy products with the loan from Maya. Fisun also works in a cafeteria part time. She is a strong and tenacious woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Fisun hanım,çocuk çamaşırı,pijama,gecelik v.s satıyor.  Ürünleri evden ve gezerek satışını yapıyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile mal alacak.  Fisun Hanım aynı zamanda yarım zamanlı bir yemekhanede çalışıyor.  Güçlü ve direngen bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes

loans.name: Bintiamisi

texts.en:
Bintiamisi is a widowed woman with seven schoolgoing children.She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bintiamisi has operated a coconut selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new furniture and hair products for his barber shop

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en: Benedictor, 52 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. He has managed a rice farm business in their village for almost 10 years. With this he earns a net income of PHP 10,000 last cropping. He used his net income in repairing their house. Due to insufficient funds for his farming business he would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm. He's hoping that his farm will continue to become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Genaline

texts.en:
Genaline previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Genaline hopes to open her own store franchise and dreams of making improvements to their home. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ligia Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ligia, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 7 años que estudian en escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña Ligia es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con su esfuerzo ganar sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Avon Yanbal y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días ya que además de salir a recorrer también vende en su casa, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva tres años dedicada a esta actividad. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The loan group Jesús De Nazaret  [Jesus of Nazareth] meets every fifteen days in the 15 de Abril neighborhood in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in all seasons. Manta is known for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions. 
Ligia lives here in Manta in a common-law relationship. She has two children aged 8 and 7 years who are in school. Her husband is a fisherman. 
Ligia is a woman who likes to stand on her own two feet with her effort to earn her own income for the sake of her family. She sells clothing, shoes, and products from Avon, Belcorp, and Yanbal (beauty prefects, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). She works everyday, selling as a traveling vendor but also at home. She sells on credit and is paid weekly. She has done this work for 3 years. 
This loan is going to be used to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, jewelry, and cosmetics. She has been in this credit group for 3 years and would likes their help in providing loans. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, and more to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 59 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Rosita has been pig fattening for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old and married with two children. Both are in school. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sebastiana Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Sebastiana, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos es enfermo por lo cual requiere de muchos cuidados. Su esposo ya no trabaja por la edad.
Doña Sebastiana es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro por el bien de familia, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende ropa, colas, jugos, gelatinas que ella mismo prepara entre otras cosas, allí le ayuda  su marido mientras ella tiene que atender a su hijo el cual sufre de una muy grave enfermedad, así ella se gana sus ingresos que le permiten salir adelante a ella y su familia, ya son 17 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar colas, ropa, aguas entre otras cosas que vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que los créditos le han brindado todo este tiempo. Sus sueños son que su hijo se sane.
texts.en:
The loan group Jesús De Nazaret  [Jesus of Nazareth] meets every fifteen days in the 15 de Abril neighborhood in the city of Manta which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in all seasons. Manta is known for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions. 
Sebastiana, 69, lives here in Manta. She is married and has five adult children. One of her children is very sick and requires a lot of care. Her husband is no longer employed due to his age.
Sebastiana is a strong woman who has had to work hard for the sake of her family. She has a small space in her home where she sells clothing, sodas, juices, and gelatin desserts she prepares herself, among other things. Her husband helps her when Sebastiana needs to care for her son who suffers from a serious illness. She has done this work for 17 years and uses their earned income for her family's progress. 
The loan will be used to buy sodas, clothing, water, and other things to sell. She has been a member of this credit group from its outset and she likes the help they give her, especially the loans. Her dream is that her son will regain his health.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, clothing, and other items to sell

loans.name: Liliana Katiusca

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Liliana, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan a financiar su negocio.
Doña Liliana es Ingeniera contables y realiza muchos trabajos de asesoría contables para personas naturales en la ciudad, pero además de esta actividad ella también se dedica al comercio, hace tres años atrás con lo que tenia adecuo un local en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de artículos de bazar, ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes, regalos, tarjetas entre otras cosas, allí también realiza recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras con lo cual le queda algo más de ingresos, su mamá le ayuda con su negocio cuando ella está ocupada con sus trabajos contables.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, y todo de lo que ella vende. Sus sueños es tener un gran local para su bazar y asesoría contable.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jesus of Nazareth Group meets every fifteen days at the April 15th neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for beautiful beaches that are frequently visited throughout the year and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions.
 
Liliana, a single 26 year old, lives here with her parents. She has been with the communal bank for four cycles. She likes the group because the loans are fast and they help finance her business.

Liliana is an accountant who performs many accounting jobs for individuals in the city, but aside from this activity, she is also works in sales. Three years ago with savings she had put aside,  she set up a storefront in her home from where she sold all kinds of bazaar items: clothing, shoes, handbags, perfumes, gifts, and cards, among others; she also provides cellphone credit refills from various phone providers which provide her with more revenue. Her mom helps her with the business when she is busy with her accounting work. 

This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, and all items that she sells. Her dream is to have a great locale for her bazaar and accounting business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her tailoring business. Aside from this, she has also been engaged in buying and selling herbal medicines and food supplements for years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Delia is requesting a new loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional merchandise to sell, specifically more quantities of coffee and herbal products to expand her product inventory. She will also purchase additional frozen goods and improve her capital for her tailoring business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Delia hopes to become a more productive and successful entrepreneur. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, and other materials as well as herbal products and frozen foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en: Matiya is 40 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his family in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise. He earns additional income from farming, which was a family activity. Matiya began the retail business to pay school fees for his children. He has a dream of expanding his business into new markets. Matiya is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ann-Ann

texts.en:
Ann-Ann is 30 years old and married with two children.

Ann-Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Ann-Ann has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ann-Ann aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married, a mother of two children and lives in Msambweni. She sells green groceries, helped by her family. Mwanakombo is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She says she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Mwanakombo is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
