Faten is a 29-year-old married woman from Rafah. She is a mother of four children.. Faten works as an employee in the public sector where she earns a low income. Faten and her husband have a store selling electrical goods and home appliances. It has been open for the past four years. 
Faten took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband buy more electrical goods for their store to resell. This will improve the store and increase its sales. 
Faten appears in the photo in her store

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods for her store to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a seaweed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy plastic rope, bottles, etc for her seaweed business.

Teresita has been in this business for five years.Teresita earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy plastic rope, bottles, etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her seaweed business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 41-year-old female living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a restaurant business alongside a rental business for additional income. She started her business to be self employed and earn a living. She hopes to educate her children, though she is challenged by high license fees. Harriet wants a loan to buy equipment like plates and sauce pans to use in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy equipment like plates and sauce pans to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Kabini

texts.en:
Kabini operates a retail shop business selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Kabini dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour,and beans to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support she received from the previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and beans to resell.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, 46 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as cook at a private firm since 2010. Her husband also works at the same company as a sentry. Their son has a disability and goes to a particular school. 

Tsetsegmaa is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to buy an LCD television for the coming national holiday. As a result, her family can watch the national wrestling championship on their newly-bought TV.

loans.use: to buy an LCD television.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps and ice-boxes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Teresita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
This is Mishi. She previously accessed a loan that she used for her maize selling business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of maize for resale. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is a mother of four children who are going to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwikali has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. Mwikali dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future when she expands her business.

With the 40,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for sale at her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for sale in her business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tienen muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con mucha amabilidad.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Luis un hombre luchador de 46 años el mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la misma tienen 3 hijos el mayor de 8 años y el ultimo de 2 años, la esposa no trabaja ella pasa en casa cuidando a los niños, vienen de familias humildes de bajos recurso económicos, lo que les imposibilito de continuar estudiando solo tienen primaria. 
Se dedica al servicio de mecánica automotriz aprendió de este negocio en su niñez y adolescencia junto con sus hermanos mayores, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 10 horas por día, durante este tiempo recibe la ayuda de su esposa en algunas actividades, 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio comprará herramientas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela, con esta nueva inversión mejorarán sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia, el señor Luis agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Pedro Vincente Maldonado is a beautiful canton with wet, warm weather. The people are very friendly and hardworking. This canton is the destination for many tourists as they have many inns where you can relax and be treated with a lot of kindness.
Luis lives and has a business in this canton. He is a hard worker who has a strong relationship with his partner. They have 3 children. The oldest is eight and the youngest is 2. His wife does not work, she stays in the home looking after their children. They come from poor families with low economic resources which made it impossible to continue in school. They only have a primary school education.
In his childhood and adolescence, he learned this business from his brothers. He works an average of 10 hours per day often assisted by his wife for some activities. 
He applied for this loan to invest in the business with new tools to provide better service to his customers. This new investment will improve their income and the family's quality of life. Luis thanks Kiva and Fundacion Alternativa for the support and the opportunities that they are providing.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: April Lou

texts.en:
A loan from GDMPC will absolutely help April Lou to pay the school tuition fee. The availability of this fund is a channel to continue her studies. 

With this loan, April Lou is expecting to study well for she will become confident in her financial aspect. 

She studies at the university because she had an ambition of having a better education. 

She hopes to have a better job in the future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Tita has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing for five years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

Tita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has four school-going children. They own a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanamisi has operated a retail business selling paraffin for use in cooking to neighbours. In addition, she also operates a phone charging business which earns her other source of income. She faces a challenge of delayed payments, hence low profits in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase two gallons of paraffin to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two gallons of paraffin to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 38 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihija greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for her previous Kiva loan that improved her retail shop. She managed to add more stock in her business, thus earned more income.

Besides the retail shop, Bihija prepares sweet dumplings and sells them to her customers.

She is requesting for a loan to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en:
Ndunge operates a vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. Her previous loan helped her to buy a variety of vegetables for sale and fruits as well. In addition, she also runs a small shop to supplement her income.

Now she is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and one small daughter. Mohammad is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.  He would like to improve his income and the family's living conditions. One year ago, Mohammad opened a small store to sell car repair parts and accessories. It is a good business and the demand is high

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of car accessories for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his income.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo while he is in his store

loans.use: to buy a new collection of car accessories to resell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 57 years old, married and blessed with three children. Due to the hardships of life, she helps her husband in gaining income to sustain the necessities for their family. She runs a small retail store while her husband works on their farm. She aims to continue and improve her small store but she has limited capital. For this reason, she wants a loan of PHP10,000 to buy additional stocks of grocery items, rice, frozen foods, meat, fish and vegetables to resell. She is hoping that she will use her loan request to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items, rice, frozen foods, meat, fish and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Yolanda Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Fuerza Y Valor, esta es una zona urbana marginal muy poblada y trabajadora. 
En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 17 y  15 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es Ing. Civil.
Doña Yolanda con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, vende a crédito y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace dos años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por ya ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
Every 15 days, Grupo de Crédito Fuerza Y Valor [Strength and Courage Credit Group] meets in the residential community named Los Cerezos [The Cherry Trees] in the city of Portoviejo. This is a small urban area that is highly populated and very hard-working.

In this place lives Yolanda, a 42-year-old woman, who is married and has three children (19, 17, and 15) with her husband. Her children are in college and secondary school, and her husband is a civil engineer.

Wanting to be able to rely on her own income, Yolanda sells Avon, Esika, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women) for a living, as well as selling clothing via catalog. She works every day, usually in the morning because that time works better for her rounds. She sells door-to-door, accepting credit and charging her customers weekly. She has done this for 2 years, and it has gone very well for her; she has many clients. The cosmetics and perfumes are what she sells the most.

She is going to use this loan to purchase clothing, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions. She has been part of her Credit Group since its beginnings, and she likes it because it has already helped to furnish loans. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions

loans.name: Esmaylita

texts.en:
Esmaylita is 56 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Esmaylita is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Esmaylita has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Jacqueline Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Fuerza Y Valor, esta es una zona urbana marginal muy poblada y trabajadora. 
En este lugar vive la señora Jacqueline, tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor tiene 15 años y  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Jacqueline como buena esposa realiza el crédito para el negocio de su marido, el se dedica a la venta de ropa, gafas, relojes entre otras cosas por toda la ciudad, siempre busca la mercadería que este de temporada ya que es la que mas salida tiene y le deja mejores ganancias. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, gafas, relojes entre otros productos que el vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque  con los  créditos ella ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, Grupo de Crédito Fuerza Y Valor [Strength and Courage Credit Group] meets in the residential community named Los Cerezos [The Cherry Trees] in the city of Portoviejo. This is a small urban area that is highly populated and very hard-working.

In this place lives Jacqueline, who is 43 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, and they have 4 children: 3 adults and a 15-year-old who is in secondary school. Her husband is a salesman.

As a supportive wife, Jacqueline is requesting this loan on behalf of her husband. He works selling clothes, glasses, watches, and other items throughout the city. He is always looking for current merchandise because it sells the quickest and at the best prices. He has done this work for more than 10 years, to support his family.

Jacqueline will use this loan to purchase clothing, glasses, watches, and other products that he sells. She has been part of this credit group since its beginnings, and she likes it because she is able to help her husband with the loans. Her dream is to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, glasses, and watches, among other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair her home.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline esta casada y tiene un hijo Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino Jaqueline se dedica a la reposteria y quiere un credito para la compra de un horno e insumos de reposteria (harina, azucar, sal, mantequilla, etc) El marido de Jaqueline es conductor de taxi y le ayuda pero eso no alcanca por eso Jaqueline espera que la gente de Kiva le ayude a potenciar su negocio
texts.en:
Jaqueline is married and has one son. She lives in La Paz in an adobe house. Jaqueline is a baker and wants a loan to purchase an oven and baking supplies (flour, sugar, salt, butter, etc.).

Jaqueline's husband is a taxi driver, which helps but doesn't cover expenses, so Jaqueline hopes that Kiva lenders will help her strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and baking supplies (flour, sugar, salt, butter, etc.)

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhonny esta casado y tiene 4 hijos Jhonny vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad y tiene rajaduras en la terraza Jhonny trabaja como garzon y desea hacer refacción de vivienda, especificamente mejorar la terraza de su casa para tener un lugar mas seguro donde vivir Jhonny es la unica fuente de sustento en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Jhonny is married and has 4 children. He lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house, which is on his property. It has cracks in the roof, which is also a terrace. Jhonny works as a waiter and wants to repair his home, particularly the terrace, so that it will be a safer place to live. Jhonny is the only source of income for his household, so he needs your assistance.

loans.use: to repair his home, particularly the roof terrace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: remodel his home (fix the floor and roof of his house).

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is  taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is a 33-year-old married woman with  five children She is runs a second hand shopt that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to increase her inventory of trousers, shorts, long and short sleeved shirts, and skirts. She opened her second hand shop a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, long and short sleeved shirts, and skirt

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old and married with four children, all attend school. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 10,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy more groceries to sell.

Grace has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, sardines, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eun

texts.en:
Eun, who lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, has three married children - one son and two daughters. Two children live outside the family home.

Eun sells Khmer noodles and Num Banh Chok in her village. Khmer noodles are considered the national dish of Cambodia, served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. Her husband assists in her business. 

Eun’s son-in-law wants to buy a motorcycle for transportation, but lacks the money to make the purchase. Hence, Eun is requesting this loan to make the purchase. 

Photo: The motorbike pictured belongs to Eun; it is not the one that Eun wants to buy for her son-in-law.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for ten years. She gets additional income from selling firewood from home in her neighborhood. 

Rose has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel is studying at the university and she wants to have a better future. In addition, she is working as an administrative intern at a well-known business in her town. She has taken and repaid previous loans for her school costs and other expenses. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to pay school fees for this current semester. She is grateful for this opportunity and the support she has received, and she plans to put her studies to good use by getting a job to support her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for this current semester.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 29-year-old married man who has been blessed with three children.  His wife adds an additional income to support their family. Jackson has operated a  a butcher shop for fifteen years and earns 15,000 KES every month.

Jackson requests his fourth loan of 70,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy cows and goats to slaughter for his clients.

Jackson plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and purchase land to build a permanent house for his family.  He hopes to improve the family's standard of living and to become a successful businessman in the near future.

loans.use: to buy  cows and goats.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente estudia la carrera de Administración y Negocios Internacionales en la Universidad, es una persona muy estudiosa. También desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en una gran empresa, le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable, amable y alegre.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado, él podrá pagar la matrícula de la Universidad y cubrir otros gastos de materiales. Asimismo podrá realizar algunos arreglos a su vivienda para más adelante poder alquilar cuartos y así tener un ingreso adicional con el que podrá apoyar a su familia. De esta manera, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Juan is a young entrepreneur.  He is 28 years old, single and lives in San Vicente with his family.  He is a person with a strong desire to get ahead.  He is currently studying for a career in administration and international businesses in the university.  He is a very studious person.  Also, for the past year, he has worked in a large company.  It has gone very well for him because he is very hardworking, responsible, kind and happy.

Juan is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because with their help, he will be able to pay for his college tuition and pay for his materials.  Likewise, he will be able to make some repairs to his house so that in the future he will be able to rent out rooms in order to generate an additional income to support his family with.  This way, with a lot of effort and dedication, he will be able to realize his greatest dream of having his own business.

loans.use: pay for his college tuition.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 49 years old and and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. Merly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Merly has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce appreciates the Kiva and Yehu support she has received in the operation of her food kiosk business, which sells foodstuffs, maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. The high cost of seasonality is her major challenge. Joyce dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this Kshs 20,000 loan, Joyce will purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is married and has three children. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past four years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are high transportation costs and stiff competition. 

She will use 15,000 KES  to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leze

texts.en:
Leze is a villager in her late fifties who has always raised livestock for a living.  She also plants and sells seasonal vegetables. 

She has been asked  to make pension contributions and this is why she is requesting this loan of 100,000 ALL.   In Albania, farmers are required to contribute towards their pension; the government does not contribute.

Leze has two dairy cows and she sells raw milk to the local people.  She also raises piglets.  In addition, she owns some 13 dynym agricultural land to plant wheat, corn, and fodder for animals. Her husband receives a pension and helps in the activities as well. Leze’s has a tractor trailer and does services for other villagers. 

Leze would very much appreciate your financial help.

loans.use: to  contribute towards her farming pension.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, está acompañado su pareja se dedica a la venta de pan, tienen 2 hijos que viven con ellos  y estudia solamente el mayor que  es de 2do año de bachillerato, dependen de él sus hijos y un hijastro, que vive con ellos.
Desde hace doce años Luis,  se ha dedicado a la comercialización de ganado y se transporta en vehículo ajeno prácticamente lo realiza cuatro veces a la semana, el horario es de 7 am a  4pm.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado de buena calidad y en un futuro poderla vender, para obtener ganancias y satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar 
En un futuro espera comprar un terreno para trabajar con ganado y leche propia, ya que tiene conocimiento de la ganadería lechera, además espera que sus hijos sean unas personas de bien, que puedan valerse por sí solos.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old, studied until third grade, and is in a relationship. His partner sells bread for a living. They have 2 children, who live with them. Only the older one, who is in his second year of secondary school, attends school. Luis' 2 children and a step-son who lives with them depend on Luis for support.

For the past 12 years, Luis has sold livestock for a living, and he transports them in someone else's car practically 4 times a week. His schedule is from 7am to 4pm.

He needs this loan to purchase good quality livestock, which he can sell to earn an income and cover his home's basic necessities.

In the future, he hopes to purchase land to work with livestock and dairy, since he already has knowledge of dairy cattle. Also, he hopes that his sons will be successful people, who can make their own way.

loans.use: to purchase good quality livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee nursery and prepare the land to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to the first hybrid solar pay for use micro grid in Haiti

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to the first hybrid solar pay for use micro grid in Haiti

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Otgondalai

texts.en:
Otgondalai, 24 years old, lives with her parents and four-year-old son in Darkhan, which is the second largest city of Mongolia. 

Three months ago, she started a  grocery store.  Prior to that occupation, she was a hair dresser. Her father works as a sentry while her mother works as a janitor at the high school. 

She requests 2,000,000 MNT to buy bulk quantities of food. As a national holiday approaches, it is better to reserve food because she doesn't want to run out of inventory during the high sales period. For her, a grocery store is the main income source of her family.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of food.

loans.name: Crispa

texts.en:
Crispa owns and operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for six years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also works with determination to have a successful new business.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to improve her services. She requests 10,000 PHP to buy more beauty and hair products like straightening treatment and items needed in her business. She extends her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Crispa hopes to become free from all her debts. She also dreams that her children will have a better future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Dianah Grace

texts.en:
Dianah, 22-years-old, lives with her partner and has two young children. She raises  hogs and her partner is a farmer. 

Diana wants to earn a greater income in order to improve her living conditions and support the needs of her family. She requests 5,000 PHP to purchase hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines to improve the growth of her hogs and be able to sell them for a better price.

In this way, she could earn more income to help meet her daily needs and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, vitamins and vaccines to improve the growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old, widowed, and has three children. 

She has managed a farm in her village for almost thirty years and earns  60,000 PHP.  She uses the income  for her children's school allowances. 

She would like  48,000 PHP to  purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm. She's hoping that her farm will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested  10,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy more groceries to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, soft-drinks, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julian Antonio

texts.es: Julian tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijas (16, 14, 20, 18 años de edad) y tres hijos (25, 23, 22 años de edad. Julian es un hombre muy trabajador quien toda la vida ha trabajado como agricultor.  Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para terminar de construir un cuarto para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, arena, cemento, ladrillo, etc. De esta forma espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Julian is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their 4 daughters (20, 18, 16, and 14) and 3 sons (25, 23, 22). Julian is a very hardworking man who has spent his whole life working as a farmer.

Wanting to improve his living conditions, he decided to request this loan from FUSAI to finish building a room, for which he needs materials such as galvanized sheet metal, wood, sand, cement, brick, etc. He hopes to be able to improve the living conditions of himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, sand, cement, brick, etc. to finish building a room

loans.name: Milton Josean

texts.es:
Milton es un joven emprendedor, tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive en Calleria junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente estudia en la Universidad porque quiere convertirse en un gran profesional. También viene desempeñándose como Asistente Contable en una empresa Constructora, es muy responsable, trabajador, honesto y amable.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia. Con el sueldo que recibe ayuda a su familia en los gastos del hogar porque sus padres son de escasos recursos, sin embargo él está muy agradecido con todo lo que hasta hoy han podido darle con mucho esfuerzo y por eso quiere brindarles un futuro mejor.
Milton está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá cubrir algunos gastos de la Universidad como pago de la matrícula y otros materiales que requiera durante su ciclo de estudios. Así seguirá luchando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Milton is a young entrepreneur.  He is 22 years old, single, and lives in Calleria with his family.

He is a person who has a strong desire to get ahead.  He is now studying at the university, because he wants to become an accomplished professional.  He also works as an assistant accountant for a construction company.  He is very responsible, hardworking, honest, and friendly.  

Milton's main motivation in life is his family.  With the salary he receives, he helps his family with the household expenses, because his parents have a low income.  However, he is very grateful for everything they have given him and for all of their efforts on his behalf, and so he wants to provide them with a better future. 

Milton appreciates the Kiva lenders, because with the support that they are providing he will be able to pay for some university expenses, such as tuition and course materials that he needs during the semester.  This way, he can continue to strive to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and course materials

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She also has been operating her own house rental business for more than 13 years and she earns well from this. She and her husband work hard with the determination of having better income to provide their everyday needs.

To improve her profit, Ester would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of the boarding house. An amount of PHP 15,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that they could attract more boarders. She will also utilize the loan for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

Ester hopes to become successful and hopes for a longer and healthier life of her family. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. She draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental property.

loans.name: José Octavio

texts.es:
José de 21 años de edad, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios a nivel superior, y decidió buscar un  trabajo, cuando termino sus estudios de bachiller, dada la situación cuando el termino bachillerato en su comunidad se necesitaba un promotor de salud y él aplico a esa plaza y se la dieron. Actualmente, ya tiene 3 años de desempeñar esa labor dentro de su comunidad. Es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y con sus hermanos, ellos son los que dependen actualmente de él.  

Además del trabajo de promotor, trabaja la agricultura y este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron cuando él estaba pequeño, en la agricultura solo trabaja los días sábados ya que de lunes a viernes él trabaja de promotor de salud.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 5 sacos de fertilizantes, 2 bolsas de semilla certificada.

Sus sueños son tener alimentación para toda su familia durante un año de su cosecha que él obtenga, y así poder darle la alimentación necesaria para su familia, además parte de la cosecha que le sobra la venderá para obtener ingresos extras para ayudarle a sus hermanos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old. Due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to continue his higher education and decided to look for a job. At the time he finished his high school studies, an opportunity came up in which his community needed a health promoter. José applied for the position and was given the job. He has now been at this job for three years, working in his community. José is single and lives with his parents and siblings. They are currently dependent on him.

In addition to his job as a promoter, José also works in agriculture. He learned this trade from his parents who taught him when he was young. José only does farm work on Saturdays since he works as a health promoter Monday through Friday. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy five sacks of fertilizer and two bags of certified seeds.

His dream is to have food for his entire family throughout the year with the harvest that he obtains. As a result, they would be able to eat. In addition, part of his harvest will be sold so that he can have extra income to help his siblings with their studies.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer and two bags of certified seeds.

loans.name: Christian Leonel

texts.es:
Christian de 19 años de edad, estudio  hasta 9º grado, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, por ahora no tienen hijos pero esperan tener en un futuro y solamente viven los dos en la casa.
Christian desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura y aprendió ya que le ayudaba a su tío y su padre, además tiene en casa un pequeño taller de motocicleta que por lo general le va bien en el negocio, no tiene horario ya que los clientes lo buscan cuando lo necesitan.
El crédito lo necesita para la siembra de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y comprara insumos agrícolas, como semilla, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas, para que el cultivo tenga un buen rendimiento.
En un futuro desea tener una familia y una casa propia, con el cultivo que tenga una buena cosecha, de las ganancias pagara el préstamo y con el negocio tener buena clientela para que el negocio vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
Christian is 19 years old, and he studied up to grade 9. He is in a relationship, and his partner works as a housekeeper.  Up to now, they do not have children, but they hope to in the future. Only the two of them live in the house.

Christian has been working in agriculture for three years, having learned it by helping his uncle and his father.  He also has a small motorcycle repair shop at his home, and generally, the business goes well for him. He does not have a schedule, as the customers seek him out whenever they need him. He needs the loan in order to plant 14,000 square meters (about 3.5 acres) of corn, and he will purchase agricultural supplies such as seed, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide, so that the crop will have a good yield.

In the future, he wants to have a family and own a home.  He hopes to have a good harvest with his crop, and he will pay back the loan with the earnings; and with the business, he hopes to have a good clientele so that it will continue growing.

loans.use: to plant 14,000 square meters (3.5 acres) of corn, and to purchase agricultural supplies such as seed, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide, so that the crop will have a good yield.

loans.name: Javkhlantugs

texts.en:
Mr. Javkhlantugs, 27 years old, lives with his wife and five-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2007. His wife began to work at a beauty salon, after staying at home for five years, looking after their son. 

Javkhlantugs is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to buy a sofa, table, and drawers for his home. By doing so, he will create a comfortable environment for his family.

loans.use: to buy a sofa, table, and drawers.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hija de 22 años de edad y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Ana posee una pequeña tienda en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: cereales, aceite, café, detergente, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida quien es jornalero mantienen la economía del hogar. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, polines, etc. Para terminar de construir un cuarto.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her partner, her 22-year-old daughter, and her 14-year-old son.

Ana owns a small store in which she sells a variety of basic items such as grains, oil, coffee, detergent, etc. In this way, she makes a living, and with the contributions from her partner, who is a day laborer, they maintain their household.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood, 2-by-4's, etc. to finish building a room.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, 2-by-4's, etc. to build a room

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta tiene 47 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos. Marta es una mujer muy trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante a su familia. Marta posee un negocio de crianza y venta de gallinas y cerdos. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar y con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y adobes para la construcción de un cuarto. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Marta is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Marta is a very hardworking woman, who makes a great effort to ensure the success of her family.

Marta owns a business in which she raises and sells chickens and pigs. In this way, she earns a living and supports her household.

Wanting to improve her living conditions, she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood, and adobe to construct a room. She hopes to rely on this financing to begin construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, and adobe to construct a room

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза молодая, жизнерадостная и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями на южной части горного Таджикистана. Дилноза научилась у портнихи шитьем женской одежды. Дилноза шьёт как национальные платья, так и европейские платья. Дилноза предоставляет свои услуги уже более 2 лет местным жителям и как портниха имеет хорошую репутацию. Дилноза хочет укомплектовать свою мастерскую, то есть купить стулья, стол для кройки и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is a cheerful and purposeful young woman. She is 21 years old, unmarried and living with her parents in the southern mountains of Tajikistan. 

Dilnoza studied with a dressmaker to sew women's clothes. She sews both traditional and European dress styles. She has been in business for more than two years already and has developed a good reputation as a seamstress. She wants to equip her workshop with chairs, a cutting table and other items. Dilnoza would like to borrow 2,500 TJS for this purpose. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy chairs and a table for her workshop.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María tiene 65 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo quien es agricultor y junto a sus hijos de 35 años de edad, 18 y 16 años de edad. El hijo mayor es agricultor y aporta en la economía del hogar y los otros dos se encuentran estudiando. María se gana la vida por medio de la crianza y venta de gallinas. Ella desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar la entrada y los alrededores de la vivienda dado que cuando llueve se obstaculiza el paso.
texts.en: María is 65 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband, a farmer, and her 35, 18, and 16-year-old children. The oldest son is a farmer and helps to support the home; the others are studying. María makes a living growing and selling chickens. She wants to improve the condition of her home. Therefore, she asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel to pave the entrance and surroundings of the home, as getting inside is difficult when it rains.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to pave the entrance and surroundings of the house.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 39-year-old woman who is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a businessman and farmer and he supports her in bringing in more income for the family. She runs a retail shop in her area and this has been her business for the last nine years, earning her a monthly profit of KES 10,000 (Kenya shillings). 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use the amount to expand her business by adding more stocks of items that are currently running low in her retail shop. Phanice would like to add items, like tea leaves, sugar, bar soap, rice, and snacks. She plans to use the anticipated profits to save for her children's education as well as to expand her business.

In the future, Phanice would like her business to grow and be able to educate her children to the highest possible level.

loans.use: to buy more goods for  the shop.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Martha es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, carteras, entre otras cosas. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella realiza sus recorridos  cuatro días por semana vendiendo y cobrando  ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, también los fines de semana prepara y vende deliciosos encebollados para lo cual instala un pequeño local en su casa. Tiene más de 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le agrada lo que hace.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras y víveres para preparar los encebollados. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
The credit association Jesus De Nazaret gets together every 15 days in the 15 De Abril neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many throughout the year, and for being a city with remarkable beauty and many tourist attractions. 

This is the place where Martha lives. She is 60 years old, married and has four children -- all of whom are now adults and independent. Her husband is a driver. 

Martha is a housewife that also sells clothes, shoes, handbags and other items to help her husband with the household's expenses and to have her own resources. She sells door-to-door and takes the same route four days per week -- selling and collecting payment, as she sells on credit and collects payment every week. She also prepares and sells delicious onion-seasoned fish, for which she installs a small stand in her house. She has done this for more than 5 years and enjoys doing it. 

She is requesting this loan to buy clothes, shoes, handbags and supplies to prepare the onion-seasoned fish. She has been with the credit association for three seasons and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead in life. Her dream is to improve her food business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, handbags and supplies.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia.
Tiene 2 maravillosos hijos por quienes siempre ha luchado para poder brindarles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, los principales productos que siembra son el plátano y la yuca, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador y sobre todo porque tiene mucha experiencia en este sector y ofrece productos de excelente calidad.
Hernan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá ampliar sus cultivos para poder tener mayores ganancias, así seguirá esforzándose para convertirse en el mejor productor de la zona.
texts.en:
Hernan is an enterprising man.  He is 38 years old, and he lives in Yarinacocha with his family.

Hernan has 2 wonderful children.  He has always fought hard to be able to give them a good education and a better quality of life.  Hernan has been a farmer for more than 10 years.  He mainly cultivates bananas and cassava.  His business is going well because he is very responsible and hardworking, and most of all because he has a lot of experience in farming and offers excellent quality products.

Hernan is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support that they are providing he will be able to expand his cultivations so that he can increase his earnings.  In this way, he will continue to exert himself in order to become one of the best producers in the area.

loans.use: to expand his cassava and banana plantations

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 60 years old and married, with five children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vanny’S Group

texts.en:
Vanny was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members, Vanny and Bopha, and they live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Vanny, age 34, sells fast food and porridge from her home. She is a widowed mother with two sons. Anyway, there was a motorbike which she wanted to buy and she bought it, but she did not pay the money yet. Hence, she asked for the loan to pay for purchasing the bike.

Vanny is on the right and Bopha is on the left.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Ugilkhon

texts.ru: Угилхон родилась в 1985 году. Она не замужем. Угилхон уже более 10 лет работает в детском садике. Она работает нянечкой. Угилхон любит маленьких детей и выполняет свою работу честно и качественно. Она дополнительно вместе с отцом откармливает скот. Угилхон обратилась за займом для того, чтобы купить шифер и древесину для ремонта крыши дома. Во время дождя течет с крыши ее дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Ugilkhon was born in 1985. She is unmarried and has worked for over ten years in a kindergarten as a nurse.  Ugilkhon loves small children and does her job well. With her father she also fattens cattle. 

She wants to take a loan to buy slate and wood to fix her roof. When it rains, her roof leaks. Ugilkhon is requesting a loan of 7,500 TJS for this purpose. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy slate and wood to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Maira

texts.es:
La señora Maira es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. 
Doña Maira su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña y cal, para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Doña Maira espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en su calidad de vida y en el de su familia, espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras – Junio   2014
texts.en:
Maira is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  Maira has a business making and selling tortillas.  Her business is well-known in her community, and so there is a lot of demand for her products.  She needs a loan to buy supplies such as corn, firewood, and lime powder, so that she can continue to make her tortillas and generate income, which is very important to her household.

Maira hopes that thanks to this loan, she will be able to have the supplies she needs to continue running her business and meeting the demands of her customers so that her sales will rise.  This will be reflected in her quality of life and that of her family.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow, so that she can continue to support her family.

Choluteca, Honduras – June   2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business

loans.name: Hugo Rusber

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 27 años de edad y vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia.
Tiene dos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y su más grande motivación en la vida para salir adelante. Siempre se ha esforzado por brindarles todas las comodidades y un futuro mejor.
Estudió la carrera de Técnico Electricista. Actualmente trabaja brindando servicios de transporte con su mototaxi y también es integrante de una Orquesta tocando el clarinete. Asimismo, es dueño de un terreno agrícola y desde hace más de 10 años viene dedicándose a este negocio cultivando diversos productos como plátano, hoja de vijao, yuca, huaba, entre otros. Le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora y porque siempre ofrece productos de excelente calidad. Sin duda alguna es un ejemplo de vida.
Hugo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá ampliar la siembra de plátano, yuca, así como también innovará con el maíz, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos y seguirá luchando para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo is an enterprising man.  He is 27 years old and lives in Yarinacocha together with his family.  He has two children who are his pride and his greatest motivation to get ahead in life.  He has always made an effort to give them all the comforts and a better future.  He studied for a technical degree as an electrician.  

He currently works providing transportation services with his mototaxi and also plays his clarinet in an orchestra.  He also owns a tract of farm land and has been growing a variety of products including bananas, vijao leaves, yucca, and pacay for more than ten years.  It is going well because he is a responsible and hardworking person who sells products of excellent quality.  Without a doubt, he is an example of life.  

Hugo is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support that they have provided so that he can expand his banana and yucca crops and innovate with his corn crops.  This will allow him to earn more income and continue fighting to improve life for his family.

loans.use: to expand his yucca and banana crops and to plant corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children's shoes to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Cesar David

texts.es:
El socio Cesar David, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Cesar David tiene 55 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de imprenta, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder4 seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles entre otros para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner Cesar David belongs to the PACHAPACCARI communal bank. The bank is located in the Cuzco province and in the district of Cuzco. 

The partner Cesar David is 55 years old, has 5 children, and is single. He has different daily activities in his printing business. The partner has had this business for quite a while; it is doing well, thanks to the determination he brings each day to the business. The partner would like to be able to keep working, as to continue helping his family. 

The partner asks for a loan to buy paper and other supplies for his business. The partner feels thankful for the loan granted and is committed to fulfilling the required repayments.

loans.use: to buy paper and other supplies for his business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 62 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Los Progresista Group

texts.es:
SOLANYI. Tiene 24 años vive con sus 2 hijas de 8 y 6 años que asisten normalmente a clases. Hace 30 meses murió su esposo en un accidente. Vive en Borbón y desde hace 2 años tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas. Actividad que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de estudios salud y alimentación de sus hijas.
Es su primer crédito en FODEMI y desde ya está segura de poder crecer en su negocio por que comprara una cocineta, una carpa, 2 mesas y 8 sillas. Con estos materiales podrá brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella cocinaba con leña o carbón, donde muchas veces tenía que pagar elevadas cantidades de dinero para poder conseguirlo. 
Comenta que fue un poco difícil recuperarse de la pérdida de su esposo ya que afecto mucho a sus hijas. 
SOLANYI. Desea tener en un tiempo de 5 años su casa propia donde podrá instalar su negocio de una forma más cómoda y brindara un mejor espacio a sus hijas. Desea poder apoyarlas en su carrera universitaria para que sean profesionales y logren un mejor estilo de vida.
INFORMACION ADICIONAL.
Es un grupo conformado por 9 personas cada quien tiene negocio independiente, es su primer crédito en FODEMI y cada uno recibe la cantidad de $ 500,00 dólares. 
Agradecen mucho la gestión que hace FODEMI por que llega a los clientes en las comunidades mas lejanas y brinda la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.
Con estos créditos. Mucha gente cambia su forma de vivir por que revive la esperanza servir a su pueblo con la oportunidad de su negocio.
Quien levanta la mano en la imagen es la líder del grupo.
texts.en:
Solanyi is 24 years old and lives with her two daughters, 8 and 6, who attend classes normally.  Thirty months ago, her husband died in an accident.  She lives in Borbon and for two years she has had a small business selling food, which has helped her pay the expenses for the studies, health and food for her daughters.

This is her first loan in FODEMI and she is sure she her business will grow because she will buy a small stove, a canopy, two tables and eight chairs.  With these items, she will be able to offer more comfort to her clients.

She used to cook with firewood or charcoal for which she often had to pay large sums of money to acquire.

She comments that it was a bit difficult to recover from the loss of her husband since it affected her daughters so much.

Solanyi wants to have her own house in five years where she can place her business in a more comfortable fashion and offer a better space for her daughters.  She wants to help them in a university course of study so they can become professionals and achieve a better lifestyle.

Additional Information:
.
This is a group composed of nine people who each have independent businesses.  It is their first loan in FODEMI and they each receive the quantity of $500,00 dollars. 

They are grateful to the management of FODEMI because they reach out to clients in the most remote communities and offer them an opportunity to grow in their business.

With these loans, many people change their way of life because it revives the hope that they can serve their town with the opportunity of their business.

The person with the raised hand in the picture is the leader of the group.

loans.use: to buy a small stove, a canopy, two tables and eight chairs.  With these items, she will be able to offer more comfort to the clients in her restaurant.

loans.name: Baba Dhabaleswar Group

texts.en:
In the year 2013, four women from Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India formed a group named Baba Dhabaleswar to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Prabhasini, a simple but confident lady, is one of them. She hails from a middle class family. The lady standing at the extreme right and raising her hand in the photo is Prabhasini. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, aged 10 and 5 years. Both of her children are continuing their study in schools.

Prabhasini has been running a press paper plate-making unit in her house for the last ten years with the help and support of her husband. Now, she has four leaf-plate pressing machines. She has engaged three workers to manage her business. She supplies her products to the retailers of the same town and other towns in a 20-mile radius. She purchases raw materials such as paper and polythene from the nearest wholesale market of 200 kilometers away on a monthly basis.  

She gets a monthly income of 10,000 INR from the above business. Out of this income, she hardly is able to manage her household and business expenses. Due to the quality of her product and the timely delivery, the demand for her unit is growing day by day. But to meet the demands of the customers, finance was a problem for her. So, she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

With the present loan, Prabhasini has planned to purchase bulk paper and purchase a press machine for making plastic glasses. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as well as attract more customers. Prabhasini hopes to save enough for the extension of her existing house and better education for her sons. 

The other three members of the group are Sujata, Chandrama and Bhumi, who are running a general store, a tent house, and a groundnut vending business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase bulk paper and a press machine for making plastic glasses.

loans.name: Trinath-A Group

texts.en:
Trinath-A is a Joint Liability Group formed in the year 2014 by five active women entrepreneurs from Titilagarh town in the Bolangir district in Odisha, India to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing business. For these borrowers, this will be their third loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Sabitri (A) is one of them. The lady standing second from left in the photograph is Sabitri (A). She is a very active lady of 52 years who lives with her husband and two sons who are 27 and 24 years old. Sabitri (A) is running a multifarious business of computer and mobile services, photo studio, photocopying and cold drinks center with the help of her husband and two sons. Sabitri (A) and her husband look after the cold drinks center that is 20 years old and her sons manage the computer, mobile phone, photo studio and photocopy center. With the first loan, she purchased a refrigerator for her cold drinks center. With the second loan, she helped her son to purchase a photocopy machine. Looking into the present market demand, with this loan, Sabitri (A) wants to purchase a digital video camera for her son for outdoor shooting. Sabitri (A) says that with the income from the present enterprises, she is planning to extend the business cabin of her son. She hopes to complete the marriage of her two sons in a befitting manner. 
The other four members of the group are Puspanjali, Jyotsna, Sabitri-B and Bhagya, who are running a betel nut shop, a tea & Tiffin center, an electrical repair shop and a Tiffin stall, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase a digital video camera for her son

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Mrs. Byambasuren, 29 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling Mongolian traditional clothes to local people since 2011. Her husband is a laboratory sample collector at a mining company. Using her previous loan, she has installed a low pressure heater. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors for house renovation. As a result, her family will live in a more comfortable and warmer place. Also, they will burn less coal for heating, thereby releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 5 años y 6 años de edad. Roxana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo junto a su compañero de vida han logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante. Con de el deseo de mejoras sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del techo y del piso de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, polines, cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Roxana is 25 years old, and she lives in her own house with her life companion and her two daughters, ages 5 and 6. Roxana is a very hardworking woman who, with her life companion and much effort, has been able to support her children. 

With the desire to improve her living conditions, she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI, in order to improve the roof and the floor.  For this, she needs materials such as galvanized sheeting, purlins, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, purlins, cement, sand, and gravel, in order to repair the roof and floor of her home.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his parents in a small house. Ramzi works in a workshop, making marble and mosaic home decorations. He now has good experience in this field. He sells his products to individuals and firms and the demand is high.

Ramzi took a loan from FATEN to help him to buy raw materials for his workshop. By taking this loan, Ramzi will be able to increase his productivity and his income. Ramzi appears in the photo while working

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his marble and mosaic workshop

loans.name: Santos  Edith

texts.es:
La señora Santos es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijos y esposo.
Doña Santos su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, vende sus productos desde su casa de habitación y también sale a vender a lugares cercanos a su municipio. 
Doña Santos necesita el préstamo para la compra de ropa como blusas, vestidos, camisas, faldas, pantalones, calzonetas, etc. para seguir con su negocio ya que tiene bastantes clientes y en este momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para surtir su negocio. 
Doña Santos con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y poder cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia, desea en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y que su hijos sigan estudiando para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Junio del  2014
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her husband and children in a community in the south of Honduras. Doña Santos has had a clothing business for several years; she sells her products out of her home, and she also goes out to sell in places nearby in her municipality. 

Doña Santos needs the loan to buy clothing such as blouses, dresses, t-shirts, skirts, pants, shorts, etc. in order to continue her business. She now has many clients, and at this time she does not have the necessary resources to stock her business. With this loan, Doña Santos hopes for increased sales and to be able to cover her family's necessities. She wants, within a short time, to grow her business and for her children to continue studying so that they will have better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - June, 2014

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, t-shirts, skirts, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Cinthya Masina

texts.es:
La socia Cinthya, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 30 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltero, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de imprenta, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia  desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia a la vez trabaja en una empresa pública.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cinthya belongs to the PACHAPACCARI communal bank. The bank is located in the province and department of Cuzco. She is 30 years old, has two children, and is single. She alternates her daily activities with her printing business. It is going well thanks to the effort she puts into the business every day. She wants to be able to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family. she also works in a public agency. She is asking for the loan to buy paper, among other things, for her business. 

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy paper, among other things, for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and to pay for labor to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Hülya

texts.en:
Hülya had a shop selling underwear and pajamas. When her husband retired, they decided to return to their hometown and closed down the shop. Until she opens a new store, she plans to sell from home. She decided to get a loan from Maya because she didn’t have the capital. She’ll use the loan to buy products. As her business develops, she will increase her capital. Hülya is an honest and hardworking individual.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Hülya hanım, çamaşır,pijama v.s satışı yaptığı dükkanı varmış.  Eşi emekli olunca,yaşadığı şehre dönme kararı almışlar ve dükkanı kapamış.  Dükkan açmadan evden iş yapmayı planlamış.  Ancak,sermayesi olmadığından Maya’dan kredi almaya karar vermiş.  Kredi ile mal alımı yapacak.  İşini ilerlettikçe,sermaye artırımına gidecek.  Hülya Hanım dürüst ve çalışkan biri.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Sany

texts.en: Sany (in the photo) is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She has two children: one son and one daughter. Sany is living with her parents on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She wants to live in her own house. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to buy her neighboring land. Then Sany will build a house on the land that she plans to buy!

loans.use: To buy the neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Progreso” conformado por 05  socios esforzados y responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Carmen de 37 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al servicio de transporte público. Gracias a su trabajo Carmen ha podido  sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Su último crédito lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su movilidad. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. El grupo “El Progreso” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Carmen se encuentra de pie es la tercera del lado derecho y viste chompa negro.
texts.en:
This is the group "El Progreso", made up of 5 dedicated and responsible members, who look to improve every day. 

Carmen, aged 37, is separated with 2 dependent children. She makes a living working in public transport. Thanks to her job, Carmen has been able to move forward with her children and improve her quality of life. She will use her latest loan to do maintenance on her vehicle. Her greatest wish to is to keep working in a positive way. 

The group "El Progreso" is grateful to those who made this loan possible. Carmen is the third person from the right; she is standing, and is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her vehicle.

loans.name: Ingrid Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Ingrid, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 26 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lavandería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia  desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de sus maquinas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ingrid belongs to the PACHAPACCARI communal bank. It is located in the province and department of Cuzco. She is 26 years old, has 1 child, and is married. She alternates her daily activities with her laundry business. She has had this business for some time and it is gong well for her, thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants to be able to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She is asking for the loan to to maintenance on her machines. 

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her machines.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 32-year-old lady who is married and blessed with four children aged between 18 and 10. She manages rental property that she owns in her area and this has been her business for the last 3 years with a steady monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to construct more rooms for rental. She hopes to get more income which she plans to use to pay school fees for her children.

In future she would like to grow her business into other areas.

loans.use: to construct more rooms for rental

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Karen works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Karen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase meat, vegetables, eggs, fish, etc for her restaurant business.

Karen has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.
