loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, eggs, and fish

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Jane operates a fruits sales business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality during sunny seasons. Jane wants to use this KES 25,000 loan to purchase a variety of fruits such as bananas, mangoes, oranges and pineapples, to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits such as bananas, mangoes, oranges and pineapples, to sell

loans.name: Sisa

texts.en:
Sisa is 30 years old and married with five children.  With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Sisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Sisa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
Rula is a 39-year-old married woman from Beit Sahour, a small village near Bethlehem city. She lives with her husband and five kids; four sons and one daughter. All of her kids are attending schools. 

Rula is a teacher in a public school where she gets a low income. She also has a workshop for making souvenirs and religious gifts from seashells. It is a very popular industry. 

Rula took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy seashells for her workshop. By taking this loan, Rula will be able to increase her productivity, and also her income. 

She appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy seashells for her workshop

loans.name: Jaadamba

texts.en:
Mr. Jaadamba, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a power plant since 1999. His wife runs an automobile repair shop. Their children go to school. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy necessary equipment and tires of different sizes. He wants to expand his wife's business through high quality service based on quality equipment and tools. This will certainly attract large numbers of customers to his wife's repair shop, and generate more income, improving his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy necessary equipment and tires of different sizes.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de lacteos,la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a su clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia vende lo que son leche, quesos entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Julia continues to work at her dairy sales business. For years, she has made a living in this business which has been going well thanks to her dedication to it every day. She sells her merchandise to customers who ask for it, such as friends, family members and so on. She sells milk and cheese among other things, and she would like to continue working as she has been in order to keep supporting her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy milk, among other things. She is grateful for the loan she was granted, and promises to repay her loan according to the repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy milk among other things

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.es:
El socio Ferdinand, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 36 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de imprenta, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ferdinand, the member, belongs to the Pachapaccari Communal Bank, which is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.  He is 36 years old, he has two children, and he lives with his partner. 

He has had his business for some time, and it is going well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into it every day. He wants to be able to continue working, and in this way, continue supporting his family.

The member is requesting the loan for the purchase of paper and other items. He feels grateful for the loan, and he is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to purchase paper and other items.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old, and married to Simon, who adds additional income to their family; they are blessed with three children. Cecilia has been running a school institution for a period of one year, earning an income of KES.10,000 at the end of every month.
 
Cecilia  was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer, and is now servicing her first loan of KES.10,000. She intends to use this amount to add to her personal savings to construct a permanent and conducive classroom for the pupils. The profits she earns will be used to educate her children and buy her own land.  

Cecilia hopes to build more classrooms up to the standard eight level to accommodate all the pupils, and improve the lives of the children in her community.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build classrooms

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a female Ugandan mother of two children living in Masindi-Uganda. She sells clothes to both women and men, and her future hope is to expand her business. However, she usually complains of high transportation costs whereby she has to move to different markets for business. 

Jalia is determined to keep her family moving on, especially her children, who she would love to educate to university. 

She will use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina operates a vegetable selling stall. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation, and she appreciates the support.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and tomatoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business; she appreciates the support

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Emily has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Emily would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Due to insufficient income, Vilma aims to improve her small retail store in order to generate a higher income. She is 43 years old, married, and blessed with two school age children. Together with her husband, they aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better living. 

With this regard, she planned to acquire an additional stock of grocery items to sell, but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy an additional stock of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. 

Having this financial assistance, Vilma believes that she will further improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with three children living in Masindi. He owns a bar in a rural area. Julius started his business to earn a living and serve the demand of the people in his area. He supplements his income with farming to make ends meet. Julius hopes to educate his children and transform his business into a renowned pub, attracting more customers and increasing his sales. Julius needs a loan to buy more drinks.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, such as beer, to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and married, with four children.  With two children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santos Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Santos  es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio, venta de abarrotería en general dese hace 26 años las ventas las realiza desde su casa de habitación, sus principales clientes son personas que viven en la zona.
Doña Santos  se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio y las personas llegan a consumir sus producto en gran cantidad, solicita el préstamo para comprar de azúcar, arroz, frijoles, café, aceite, churros, aguas, etc.
Doña Santos  espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con su familia, uno de sus sueños es que su hijo pueda seguir  con sus estudios  y se gradué en un futuro. 

Danlí, Honduras – Junio 2014
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos is an enterprising woman, dedicated to commerce, who has sold general groceries for the last 26 years. She does this from her residence. Her principal customers are people who live in the zone.

Mrs. Santos rises very early to attend to her business and the people who come to purchase her products in large quantities.

Mrs. Santos hopes that this investment will be of much help to improve her business and advance her and her family. One of her dreams is for her son to be able to continue his studies and graduate in the future. 

Danlí, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, beans, coffee, cooking oil,  sweet snacks, drinks, etc., to restock her business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Luzminda is borrowing 29,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to  purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, soap, etc. to sell at her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purcahse additional stocks like coffee, milk, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela, 53 years old, is married and has seven children, one of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 20 years, Carmela has run a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase materials such as thread, needle, fabrics, etc. for her business. In the future, Carmela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread, needle, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring business

loans.name: Lilian Carolina

texts.es: Lilian tiene 27 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida vendiendo prendas de vestir como blusas,faldas, ropa interior, etc. La venta la realiza dos días por semana. Además, vende verduras y pastelitos de carne el resto de días. Tiene cinco años de contar con dichos negocios  por lo que es muy reconocida en su cantón por su trabajo y emprendedurismo y gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que cada día demandan más sus productos. Lilian solicita este crédito a FUSAI para mejorar el piso de la sala y el comedor de su hogar por lo que comprará materiales como: cemento, grava y arena, ademas pagará mano de obra para la mejora.
texts.en:
Lilian is a 27-year-old single mother and lives with her two children, ages 3 and 6. She earns her living by selling clothes such as blouses, skirts, undergarments, and other items. Lilian conducts sales two days a week. In addition, she sells vegetables and meat turnovers on the other days. She has been in these businesses for five years and is well-known in her canton for her work and her entrepreneurship. Thanks to her experience, she has a large number of customers who demand her products each day.

Lilian is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to improve the floor in the living room and dining room of her house. Therefore, she will buy materials such as cement, gravel, and sand. She will also pay for the labor to make this improvement.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to repair the floors in her living room and dining room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a living room set for his home and mechanical parts for his work.

loans.name: Sombou

texts.en:
Sambou lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has four children - three sons and one daughter. 

Sambou stays at home and does house work, while husband is a construction worker. Additionally, his business is also in buying, raising and selling cows. He hopes to increase the volume of cows he buys and sells. 

Hence, Sambou decided to apply for a loan to obtain capital to help her husband buy a cow to sell.

loans.use: To obtain capital for her husband to buy additional cow to sell.

loans.name: Ada Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Ada Mercedes de 30 años de edad, vive con su hijo en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de Rosquillas, vive en una  aldea de Pespire al sur de Honduras.
Doña Ada es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ada está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, leña y cuajada con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su hijo. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Junio del 2014
texts.en:
Ada Mercedes is 30 years old, and lives with her son in her own home. She has worked for the last five years in the business of selling donuts. She lives in the village of Pespire in southern Honduras. Ada is a very entrepreneurial woman with desires to get ahead and she strives day after day to improve her quality of life. 

Ada is requesting the loan to by products such as corn, firewood and milk curd. With the support of the loan, she aims to improve her earnings and also her quality of life. She is a new borrower with desires to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business and increase her customer base, and at the same time improve her future together with her son.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and milk curd for her business.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS HORMIGUITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Dalia ella es casada y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia elabora desayunos, almuerzo y cena, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia  a la vez vende por la noches salchipapas,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como carne, aceite, arroz entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, venta de ropa,materiala de construcción.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Las socias que salen adjuntas a la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Las Hormiguitas” (The Hard Workers) communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which is a part of Cusco  Province and Cusco Department.                                                                                                                                                                                             
Sra. Dalia is one of the members of the communal bank.  She is married, 35-years old and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily chores and her food-sales business.  She makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She has been in the business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.  Sra. Dalia also sells hot-dogs and fries and night.  She hopes to continue working in order to continue helping her family. 
Sra. Dalia is requesting the loan to purchase supplies, such as meat, cooking oil, rice and other items. 
The other members of the communal bank make their livings selling bricks, running small groceries, selling clothing and selling construction materials.  
Sra. Dalia is grateful to those who are helping make her dreams come true through the loan.  She promises to comply with the established repayment plan.   
The members who appear in the in-set photos requested permission to come to the meeting late due to conflicts with their work schedules.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as meat, cooking oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Calleria junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera, así que desde muy joven tuvo que ver la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos sola. Afortunadamente el estar sola no fue un impedimento para ella, siendo una persona innovadora inició un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y con eso pudo brindar educación a sus hijos. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio próspero y ella sigue esforzándose al máximo para salir adelante.
Maria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá arreglar su domicilio como pintarrajear las paredes y arreglar el techo, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is an entrepreneur woman. She is 58 years old, single and lives in Calleria along with her family.

She is a single mother, so from a young age she had to find the way to support her children all by herself. Luckily, being alone wasn’t an obstacle for her. 

She is an innovator, and thanks to that, she started a small business selling food, which gave her the opportunity to educate her children. Nowadays, she has a thriving business and keeps making her biggest effort to get ahead. 

Maria is thankful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she will be able to improve her house, paint the walls and fix the roof. This way she will improve her quality of life, and she will keep working as she has done until now to support her family.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is thirty years old.  His business is selling air time and mobile money transacting. He gets supplementary income from secretarial services. He is faced with hardships of inadequate funds, network failures plus competition in the open market. His aspiration is to grow his business into a large-scale mobile money services. Edward is requesting a loan to boost his mobile money services.

loans.use: to boost his mobile money services.

loans.name: Sevgi

texts.en:
Sevgi used to sew booties and vests with her machine. When she separated from her husband, her situation changed. Her daughter is married and she lives with her two other children. Now she sells cosmetics and makes items such as booties and scarves. With the loan, she will buy cosmetics and sewing supplies.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Sevgi hanım,örgü makinasıyla patik ve yelek triko işleriyle uğraşıyordu.  Eşinden ayrıldı,düzeni değişti.  Bir kızı evli,2 çocukla birlikte yaşıyor.  Kozmetik ve elde patik,şal gibi üretimde bulunuyor.
Aldığı kredi ile,kozmetik ürünleri ve elişi malzemeleri alacak.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and sewing supplies

loans.name: Kihuura Ngonzi Group

texts.en: Boniface is a married man with three children who lives in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop selling maize flour, soap and other products. He started his shop with capital from savings in their group. He obtains additional income from tea growing and has been a member of a village group where members save and guarantee one another to get a loan facility. He experiences a problem of low capital to buy his products, accompanied by  price changes as his vision is to be economically well off with proceeds from his business. Boniface needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouman 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMAN 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame  BINTOU débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMAN 7. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 30 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the Sabougnouman 7 group are married women who, on average, are 34 years old, have two children and mostly live in traditional families in Kapala, a commune in the Sikasso circle, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their first rural loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. The crop cultivated by Ms. Bintou, standing in the center of the photo in the group of Sabougnouman 7 women, is peanuts. With her loan, she expects to buy 30 kilograms of fertilizer and one container of herbicide and to pay the labor costs to maintain .25 hectares of land. After the harvest, the production will be sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele made up of men and women, for cash and for credit. She expects to make a profit of 36,000 francs CFA. This profit will permit her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides and to pay for the costs of labor.

loans.name: Sabougnouman 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMAN 8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame DITIO assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMAN 8. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 30 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the Sabougnouman 8 group are married women who, on average, are 32 years old, have two children and live for the most part in traditional families in Kapala, a commune in the Sikasso circle, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their first rural loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. The crop cultivated by Ms. Ditio, seated in the center of the photo in the group of Sabougnouman 8 women, is peanuts. With her loan, she expects to buy 30 kilograms of fertilizer and one container of herbicide and to pay the labor costs to maintain .25 hectares of land. After the harvest, the production will be sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele made up of men and women, for cash and for credit. She expects to make a profit of 36,000 francs CFA per field. This profit will permit her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and herbicides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As the married mother of six children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elsa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, to pay for labor and to improve her property and coffee crop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child and she goes to school. She has additional family members. She sells green bananas and Irish potatoes. She works seven days a week. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food. She has been in this business for two years. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO (Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO) to buy bunches of green bananas and Irish potatoes. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to start planting, especially vegetables.

loans.use: to buy bunches of bananas and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and married with six children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 36 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members, Nan and Somaly, and they live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Nan is 61 years old and a widow with three children, two sons and one daughter. She looks old, but is still strong enough to work. Nan wants to fill in the land around of her house. It’s difficult for her to live because now is the rainy season, which is when it floods. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan. 

Nan and her son are on the right and Somaly and her husband are the left.

loans.use: To fill in the land around her house.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang sells groceries, meat and vegetables at home. She buys grocery items from the market approximately six kilometers from her house. Her husband assists his wife in the business.

She wants to buy a new motorcycle for family use because the old one is breaking down and uses more gasoline. It’s difficult for her to manage on her income.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for family use.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive en Irazola junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha constantemente para poder ofrecerles mejores oportunidades y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Desde hace dos años se dedica a la agricultura, siendo su principal producto cultivado el plátano, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, innovadora y sobre todo porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad a un precio el alcance de los clientes.
Elvis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar la limpieza de su terreno para posteriormente innovar con la siembra maíz. De esta manera podrá obtener más ingresos por la venta de sus productos y así poco a poco ahorrar para poder ampliar sus cultivos para poder brindar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Elvis is an enterprising man.  He is 48-years old, married and lives in Irazola with his family. 
Elvis's main motivation in life is his family.  It is for them that he constantly works hard- to offer them better opportunities and to improve their quality of life. 
For the last two years, Elvis has made his living in agriculture.  His main crop is bananas.  Farming has been going well for Elivs because he is a very responsible, hard-working, innovating person and, above all, because he always sells high-quality products at prices that are accessible to his customers. 
Elvis is grateful for the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have offered him, he will be able to clear his fields of weeds to later update them with a corn crop.  He will then be able to earn a greater income by selling his products and, little by little, save for expanding his plantings and offering his family a better future.

loans.use: to pay for clearing his fields in preparation for planting corn.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 44 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelly has a bag-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for making bags.

Nelly has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies to make bags

loans.name: Eucaris De Jesus

texts.es:
Eucaris es una humilde mujer que entrego gran parte de su vida al negocio de las confecciones trabajando como operaria en diferentes fabricas. En un momento de su vida y en medio de su trabajo, decidió iniciar con su propio negocio independiente para estar más pendiente de sus hijos y su hogar; fue así como tomo la iniciativa de comenzar a vender productos como espumas para afeitar, perfumes, desodorantes, entre otros. Elementos que hasta ahora le han dado la oportunidad de poder generar sus propios ingresos y al mismo tiempo estar pendiente de su familia.
Ella solicita un crédito para realizar la compra de inventario en este tipo de productos, de esta forma podrá aumentar su oferta y mejorar considerablemente sus ventas, permitiéndose cumplir su sueño de tener un almacén de productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Eucaris is an uncomplicated woman who devoted a large part of her life to the business of sewing, working as an operator in various factories. In a moment of her life and in the middle of her work, she decided to begin her own independent business in order to be more attentive to her children and her household. This was how she took the initiative to begin to sell products such as shaving foam, perfumes, and deodorants, among other items, things that up to now have given her the opportunity to be able to generate her own income and at the same time tend to her family.

She is applying for a loan to purchase inventory of this type of products. In this way she will be able to increase her offerings and improve her sales considerably, allowing her to accomplish her dream of having a repository of products for personal use.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare the land like fertilizers, irrigation supplies, fumigants and seeds.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with four children and one of them goes to school. She has additional family members. She sells vegetables and fruits at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for twelve years. She has requested a loan of 650,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy greens, oranges, mangoes, pineapples and tomatoes. Her major challenges include seasonality and perishability. Her goal and aspiration is for her business to increase her capital base and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy greens, oranges, tomatoes, pineapple and mangoes

loans.name: Mastulah

texts.en: Mastulah lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with two children and one of them goes to school. She takes care of additional family members. She makes bricks for sale. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for two years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 300,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy firewood for burning bricks. Her major challenge includes the rainy season. Her goal and aspiration is for her business to prosper. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy firewood to make bricks

loans.name: G.s Jehova Nessi Group

texts.es:
La señora es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, vende conos y donas y esto lo realiza desde hace 5 años, sus principales clientes son las personas que vive en su barrio y vecinos de su comunidad,  de igual manera aprovecha los campeonatos de futbol, que se realizan en el campo de futbol de su barrio, los días domingos, para aumentar sus ventas.
Doña Ada necesita el préstamo para la compra de donas, conos y helados de fresa, chocolate y vainilla para surtir su negocio y obtener más ganancias, para seguir dándoles el estudio a sus tres hijos, solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas.
Doña Cándida  Rosa dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio venta de abarrotería  en general,  actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años.
Doña Gloria, se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio venta de fotografía enmarcada, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años, esperan que esta inversión que realicen les sea de mucha ayuda para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.

Danlí, Honduras – Junio del 2014
texts.en:
La señora Ada is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business.  She has been selling ice cream cones and donuts for five years.  Her main customers are people who live in her neighborhood and neighbors in her community.  In addition, she takes advantage of the soccer tournaments that happen on Sundays in her neighborhood to increase her sales. 
Doña Ada needs the loan to purchase donuts, cones and strawberry, chocolate and vanilla ice-cream to stock up her business and earn a greater profit.  She will then be able to continue providing her three children with an education.  She is requesting this loan as a group loan with the following people: 
Doña Cándida Rosa makes her living with a store.  She earns her income selling general grocery items and has done so for the last eight years. 
Doña Gloria makes her living with a shop.  She earns her income selling framed photographs and has done so for the last five years.  They all hope that the investments they are making help them greatly to improve their standards of living a bit, and their families' standards of living as well. 

Danlí, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: to purchase donuts, cones and strawberry, chocolate and vanilla ice cream for her business.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver, who lives in Kasese, Uganda, used the previous loan to buy cassava flour, maize flour and beans to sell. She also makes craft baskets and has a farming business to get additional income to meet her family's daily demands. Farming is where she gets additional income. She is a hard working woman. However, she is faced with the challenges of competition and customers not paying on time. She dreams of expanding her business into a big craft center. She intends to use the loan to buy materials to use in making crafts to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in making crafts to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 62 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dorothy's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dorothy has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Dorothy has taken a PHP 5,828.50 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Dorothy is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Frankil

texts.es:
Laborioso y soñador, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Frankil, un hombre trabajador y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles siempre una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
Se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado bovino en el municipio de Sonsón.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican para sobrevivir y obtener ingresos.
El posee gran conocimiento y experiencia en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de terneros en las próximas ferias de ganado pues manifiesta que así los puede comprar muy económicos.
Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia y manifiesta sentirse muy agradecido con la vida por todos los favores recibidos.
texts.en:
Industrious and dreamer are two words that perfectly describe Frankil, a hard-working family man who does what is within his power in order to always offer a better quality of life to his children and his wife.

He raises and sells cattle in the township of Sonsón. This is a very common activity in this region, and a large part of the inhabitants practice it in order to survive and to obtain income.

He has great knowledge and experience in this subject and feels that he need a little boost in order to increase his sales and expand his business. It is for this reason that he is applying for economic help to invest it in the purchase of calves at the next livestock fairs, since he declares that in this way he can buy them more economically.

With this loan he will be able to continue with his business, which is the only source of income for his family, and he states that he feels very grateful to life for all the favors he has received.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase his production

loans.name: Sakarn's Group

texts.en: Sakarn is 61 and a widow. She has two children, one of whom is still under her support. Sakarn earns money to support her small family by selling fish and raising pigs to sell. It has been around 15 years that she has been in these businesses. Having insufficient working capital to carry on the businesses after she completely repaid her previous loans, Sakarn decided to request her seventh loan from VisionFund. As a leader of the group, she used her loan portion to buy pig feed and fish to sell.  With this loan, she hopes to generate more income so that she can still support her daughter until she finishes school.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell and pig feed

loans.name: Eliberto

texts.es:
El señor Eliberto es un hombre, emprendedor que se dedica al comercio,  sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio personal, que consiste en la cría y venta de pollo de engorde, sus ventas de manera domiciliar y ambulante.
Don Eliberto cuenta con 3 años de experiencia, su familia lo apoyan de gran manera en esta actividad, sus clientes son personas y pulperías de las  comunidades vecinas, los cuales le encargan sus productos porque son de buena calidad.
Don Eliberto esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pollitos, concentrado, vacunas, vitaminas, desinfectante y así aprovechar esta oportunidad de generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia, en la foto el señor Eliberto sale mostrando su negocio de cría de pollos.

Danlí, Honduras – Junio  2014
texts.en:
Señor Eliberto is an enterprising man who makes his living in the commercial sector.  His income comes from his personal business, which is raising and selling broiler chickens.  He makes his sales through orders and as a traveling vendor. 
Don Eliberto has three years of experience in this business, and his family gives him great support.  His customers are individuals and small groceries in the neighboring communities.  They order his poultry because of its good quality. 
Don Eliberto is requesting the loan in order to purchase chicks, animal feed, inoculations, vitamins and disinfectant.  He is taking advantage of this opportunity to earn a greater income and to improve his own standard of living and that of his family.  In the above photo, señor Eliberto is shown displaying his chicken-raising enterprise. 

Danlí, Honduras – June  2014

loans.use: to purchase chicks, animal feed, inoculations, vitamins, disinfectant etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chairs for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes, costume jewelry, and handbags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and beauty products to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri lives in the village of Mec Parni in the Lori region. She is 33 years old. Meri is married and she has two school-aged children. Her husband at this moment is in the Russian Federation. From there, he supports his family financially, while Meri in the village works and runs a farming and agriculture business. Meri graduated from Vanadzor Medical College as a pediatrician. Now she works at the city hospital as a nurse. Simultaneously with her beloved work, she runs the farm. On her farm, she takes care of three cows and two calves. From her plot of land, she gathers a perfect harvest of potatoes, which re-sellers buy right from her house. As Meri says, she is happy in her sunny village with her family and cute farm, but she dreams of making it richer.
 
She is asking for a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams in order to buy several beehives and some tools for working with the hives. She wants to have pure and healing honey from her farm, which will be very useful both for her children and profitable to sell as well.

loans.use: to buy several beehives and beekeeping tools

loans.name: Havva

texts.en:
Havva has two children and lives with her large extended family. She sells hand-sewn items, lace, embroidery, kerchiefs and cosmetics. She doesn’t want to depend on anyone for her or her children’s needs, but rather wants to earn and spend her own money. She also wants to build up savings. She’ll use the loan to buy cosmetics and materials for sewing in order to earn more.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Havva Hanım,2 çocuğu var ,kalabalık bir ailede yaşıyor.  Elişleri,dantel,oya,yemeni ve kozmetik ürünleri satıyor.  Kendisi ve çocukları için kimseden birşey istemeden para kazanıp harcıyor.  Kendisine birikim yapmayı düşünüyor.  Aldığı kredi ile kozmetik ürünleri ve elişleri için malzeme alacak.Daha çok para kazanacak.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny (in the photo) is 25 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2012 and has no children yet. Vanny is a waitress at a restaurant in Phnom Penh. Her husband also works alongside his wife.
  
Vanny wants to fill in the land around of her house. It’s difficult for her to live because now is the rainy season when the water floods. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan, which she will also use to repair the walls of her house.

loans.use: To fill in the land around her house and repair the walls

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à BOGOTIERI un village dans la commune de DANDERESSO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame SALIMATA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who on average are 45 years old with six children, living for the most part in traditional families in Bogotieri, a village in the Danderesso commune, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Salimata, who is standing in the second position from right to left in the photo of this Benkadi 2 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 74,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay for plowing

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à BOGOTIERI un village dans la commune de DANDERESSO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame MICHATA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

The six members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who on average are 42 years old with five children, living for the most part in traditional families in Bogotieri, a village in the Danderesso commune, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Michata, who is standing in the middle of the photo of this Benkadi 3 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two containers of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 33, married and has four schooling children. They live in a rural community and earn their living through farming. Due to financial insufficiency, she is engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to generate additional income. She aims to acquire more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Jean is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stock of cucumbers, beans, cabbages, tomatoes and bananas to sell. Through hard work and strong determination, she is hoping that she can make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional cucumbers, beans, cabbages, tomatoes and bananas to sell

location.town: Brgy. Sto.Domingo West, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is a Cameroonian, 49 years old, who is married with two children. Her older child is 20 and in the University while the younger is 17 and in high school. She has been in business for over eight years, which makes her very experienced and her business stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her monthly turnover from 300,000 to 600,000 FCFA

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and dried meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to stock his business and increase his sales.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à BOGOTIERI un village dans la commune de DANDERESSO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame ADIARA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 37 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women who on average are 28 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Bogotieri, a village in the Danderesso commune, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Adiara, who is standing in the middle of the photo of this Benkadi 4 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.25 hectares (about 0.62 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 37,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, baking soda, cheese, milk etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with three children who are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She is a retailer who has been selling sniffing tobacco for the last two years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of tobacco for her business.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more gallons of paraffin for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of paraffin for her business

loans.name: Allakan Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe ALLAKAN SOUTRA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à  BATIEMOGOBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame MADIALIA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  ALLAKAN SOUTRA . 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Allakan Soutra group are married women who on average are 41 years old with four children, living for the most part in traditional families in Batiemogobougou, a village in the Loulouni commune, which is part of the Sikasso region, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Madialia, who is sitting in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Allakan Soutra group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her on the one hand to pay off her loan and its interest, and on the other hand to help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his shop with more new merchandise.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is an old client who is married with eight children, with three still attending school. He carries out cattle trade as his major source of income; he has done this business for a period of 15 years. However, Patrick was constrained with limited capital, which affected his competitiveness in the market; therefore, he decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance in order to expand his business and meet his family's financial obligation. 

Patrick will use this loan to buy more cows for trade and earn more profits from the sale of cows. Patrick appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for their financial support, which has enabled him to educate his children and sustain his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows for trade

loans.name: Fitnete

texts.en:
Fitnete is a married mother of six children. She has been photographed plowing the soil in her backyard, where currently she has planted mostly corn, beans and cucumbers. She wants to buy a dairy cow with the loan she is requesting from Kiva lenders.

Besides the planting that Fitnete does in her backyard, she also has grapevines and chickens. Under the communist era, she relocated from her village to the current suburbia of a little industrial town, then in central Albania. She worked in the worker’s kitchen, and her husband did labor work in the same super-phosphate plant until the early '90s, from where they earned a pension. Their children are all grown-ups now and work for themselves.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à BEMABOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame  KAGNA  débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 1.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Kagna, who is standing in the middle of the photo of this Benkadi 1 group of women.

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 97,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her one the one hand to pay off her loan and its interest, and on the other to help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a 59 year old man who is married and has six children between 9 and 18 years old. He has been practicing crop and animal farming for 16 years and getting a monthly profit of Kenya shillings 25,000 which he uses to support and provide for his family needs.

He has applied for his third loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to buy a solar lamp so that his children do not strain too much with the other kerosene lamps when reading. He hopes to get a good harvest so that the money can be used to repay this loan and also expand his farming activities.

In the future he would like to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 23 years old and has one child who is in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Mary Jane would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sirarpi

texts.en:
Sirarpi is 44 years old, and she lives in the village Amrakic of Lori region. She is a chemist for her profession, but she never worked in her specialty. Sirarpi used to work at a bridal salon as a designer, and she organized wedding and other parties, which usually need some decoration and show programs. Now she works at the restaurant also as a designer. 

Together with her work, she dreams of having many beehives (now she has 30 beehives and small production of honey) and produce a lot of tasty and useful honey, which her father used to do. As Sirarpi says, there was a time that in their region her father’s farm honey was known so well, that from Yerevan city people drove long distances to their village in order to buy her father’s farm honey. Sirarpi says that her father taught all the skills and unlocked all the secrets of beekeeping for her, with great hope that his daughter will follow his way.

Sirarpi is married, and she is a mother of three children.

This loan in an amount of 500,000 Armenian drams will help Sirarpi to buy a lot of bee families and beehives in order both to enlarge her honey production and her family income.

loans.use: to buy a lot of bee families and beehives

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en: Bayartsetseg is a bachelor degree student who studies in a local public university to be a nurse of livestock. She has mentioned that demand for the profession is quite high; thus she can get a job quickly. Her long term goal is to build a house on her estate and hold a savings account in XacBank. This loan has given her an opportunity to keep studying without any delay.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à BEMABOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali.
