texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame  DJENEBA YAYA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women who on average are 52 years old with five children, living for the most part in traditional families in Zerlaba, a village in the Sikasso circle, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Djeneba Yaya, who is standing in the second position from left to right in the photo of this Benkadi 1 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy four 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, four containers of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain one hectare (about 2.47 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 140,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay plowing costs

loans.name: Siphen

texts.en:
Siphen (in photo) is 39 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two daughters who are in school.

Siphen is a construction worker, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. He wants to change his business to be a moto kangbei taxi driver so he can carry more people and earn extra income. Hence Siphen decided to apply for a loan to buy a moto kangbei for her husband.

In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

loans.use: to buy a moto kangbei for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cabinets, shelves and an assortment of groceries to start with her own business.

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
Frances, is a single woman who has experienced much loss in her life and yet, through her work continues to be a positive influence in this community. Frances is a Pediatric Occupational Therapist and needs to work out of her home to support herself and to comfortably assist her young patients, ranging from 0 – 18 years of age. Her struggle began when she tried to save her childhood home after her parents suddenly passed in 1996. At that time, she was also caring for her aunt, who also eventually passed. As a result of her having to care for family members and the subsequent losses, Frances found herself struggling not only to save her childhood home, but also to survive financially. She ended up losing both her parents’ and her aunt’s home, and was left with barely enough to buy a humble house that she knew needed some aesthetic improvements. 

The new home had passed an inspection and therefore Frances was not aware of the severity of damages in the home.  When she moved in, she found that the home was plagued with problems such as, multiple holes in the roof, a falling ceiling and several other leakage issues that made the home practically uninhabitable. Frances has had to keep her belongings in storage, her pets boarded, and has almost depleted her savings trying to fix the home to make it livable.  Her ultimate goal is to gain financial strength and stability so that she can provide a safe and secure environment for herself, as well as for her young patients. She keeps her hopes up and continues to make a positive difference in the lives of the young boys and girls that she helps. 

With her KIVA loan, Frances will be able to install a drywall ceiling and a much needed air conditioner that will allow her to improve her services by providing a healthier, more comfortable and overall better environment for herself and her patients.

loans.use: To pay for a new ceiling and air conditioner to make her house more livable.

loans.name: Mischelle

texts.en:
Mischelle (pictured top left) is a widowed, single mom who has struggled financially through the years since her husband’s passing. She had to work 2 jobs to support and raise her two children alone. For the past few years, Mischelle has supported her daughter Megan (pictured right) with two small grandchildren, Riley (The young girl in Megan's arms) 1 ½ and Christian (pictured bottom left) 6 years old. Not only has she been her daughter’s main source of emotional and financial support when it comes to the care of her grandchildren, Christian and Riley, but Mischelle has also taken on the role of being the main financial provider for the family. 

Her 6 year old grandson, Christian has multiple health issues including, but not limited to ailments that are intensified by the severe heat and humidity in Florida. The medical attention needed for this child is a heavy financial burden on Mischelle who is a security associate at a retirement community. Mischelle’s ultimate goal is to further her education, which was put on hold when she was widowed many years ago.  She aspires to better herself and her financial situation, and to be able to provide stronger financial support for her family.  

Michelle will use her KIVA loan to install a new air conditioner which will maintain good air quality, a crucial component in controlling her grandson Christian’s allergies. This loan will help provide a healthy and comfortable living environment for her family.

loans.use: To pay for a new air conditioner to help improve the health of Mischelle's grandson as well as provide overall comfort for her family.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She still sells clothes. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase more bales of clothes and pay for the education of her daughter. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes and pay for the education of her daughter.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, a 35-year-old woman, is married with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Justine sells second-hand clothes at a business she has operated since 2009. She is working very hard to expand her business into a big shopping center. Justine is faced with the challenges of inadequate capital and seasonality factors. 

She needs the loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.es: Edwin tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de un año de edad. Edwin es albañil y desde hace 18 años ha trabajado prestando sus servicios  de albañilería. Él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo y comprometido a su familia. Edwin solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una champa para el área de lavandería para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, polines, pernos,etc. Y así poder dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Edwin, 36, lives in his own home with his common-law wife and their one-year-old daughter.  He is a bricklayer and has been working for 18 years offering his construction services.  He is a very dedicated, hard-working man who is committed to his family.

Edwin is requesting a loan through FUSAI to build a roof over his home's laundry area.  He needs to buy metal sheeting, beams, nuts and bolts, etc.  This will allow him to begin construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams, nuts and bolts, etc. to build a roof over the laundry area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a small hardware business.

loans.name: Marta Miriam

texts.es: Marta tiene 47 años de edad y se dedica  a la venta de variedad de ropa para niña de manera ambulante. Tiene 18 años de contar con dicho negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Marta desea construir un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento, grava, hierro, etc. y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Marta, 47, works as a street vendor selling girl's clothing.  She has been in business for 18 years and, thus, has acquired much experience and many customers who prefer her products.  

Marta wants to build a bedroom and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy bricks, sand, cement, gravel, iron, etc. to start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy bricks, sand, cement, gravel, iron, etc. to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 30 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, Chantal would like to buy more foodstuffs such as bananas, beans and peas to sell. With the profits from the business, she will be reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beans and peas to sell

loans.name: Anushik

texts.en:
Anushik is 56 years old and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Anushik is married and she has a son and two daughters. All of her children are married and live separately with their families. Anushik has no higher education and she worked at different workshops and factories as a worker. She has great experience in the trading business. She has been running a fruit and vegetable trading business since 1998. She buys her stall products (pears, peaches, bananas, apples, watermelon, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, greens, etc.) from the farmers in the nearby villages and re-sells it at the city wholesale market. 

Anushik is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to enlarge the assortment of her stall, especially the fruit, which is in great demand during this summer season.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to enlarge the assortment in her stall

loans.name: Maria Ninfa

texts.es:
A sus 42 años de edad María es una muy sonriente y alegre madre de 3 hijos uno de ellos menores de edad y los otros dos apenas con la mayoría de edad cumplida por lo que viven y depende de ella ya que siempre es primero el estudio.
Por cosas del destino y problemas familiares se tuvo que separar de su esposo y se dedicó a la venta de dulces, frituras, papas en bolsa y antojos los cuales distribuye cerca de un colegio por lo que en el momento ha tenido buen éxito en sus ventas.
Solicita un crédito para aumentar su producción distribuyendo nuevos productos de otras marcas, más chocolates en barra, dulces acaramelados, otras marcas de frituras con lo que espera seguir apoyando a sus hijso en su camino al progreso.
texts.en:
At 42 years old, María is a very smiley and happy mother of three children, one of whom is a minor. The other two are just over 18 years old and still live at home and depend on their mother. Their studies are their priority.

Due to family problems and other circumstances, María had to separate from her husband and now she makes a living selling sweets, fried snacks, chips and other snacks. She sells these items near a school and has, so far, had a lot of success.

María is applying for this loan in order to increase production and sell new brands of products. She will sell more chocolate bars, caramel sweets and other fried foods. María hopes that, by doing this, she will be able to guide her children along a path towards progress.

loans.use: to buy new brands of chocolate bars, caramel sweets and fried snacks.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, a sus 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre anda en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección. oficio que aprendió de manera empírica por medio de la observación, luego, poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller.
Adecuó un espacio en la casa donde reside y con unos ahorros compró sus primeras máquinas, trabaja sola todos los días, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de contratos que tenga; de esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. 
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará una máquina para pegar botones con la que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio. 
Cristina manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia en el mercado, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and a hard-working and strong woman. She is always looking for new ways that will allow her to progress in life.

For five years Cristina has been working as a dressmaker. She learned this trade on the job, observing others at work. Later, little by little, Cristina perfected her techniques and developed her knowledge through practice. This drove Cristina to open her own workshop.

To do this, Cristina set up in a space in her home and used some savings to buy her first sewing machines. She works alone every day but, on occasion, receives support from one other person, depending on the number of orders that she may have. This work has allowed Cristina to earn a sufficient income to cover household costs.

This loan will be used to strengthen Cristina's work. She will use the money to buy a sewing machine for attaching buttons. This machine will speed up the production process, and allow Cristina to win more contracts and make her business more profitable.

Cristina tells us that her biggest challenge is competition. This, however, continues to motivate her so that she offers better service and she continues to fight so that her business operates fully and she can offer job opportunities to others. By doing all of this, Cristina can improve her quality of life, and the quality of life of others who make a difference to her work.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for attaching buttons.

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Adrián  de 27años de edad, vive con sus padres, tiene un hijo que depende de él y vive en una  comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado para damas y caballeros.
Adrian también tiene un microbús para transportar estudiantes que es otro ingreso que recibe, su venta la realiza en su local ubicado en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, es una persona emprendedora y con deseos de salir adelante.
Adrian está solicitando e préstamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, camisas, faldas, calzonetas y zapatos ya que se acerca la feria del pueblo y el  desea surtir su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para surtir su negocio y de esta manera tener mejores ganancias que ayudan a mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y un bus mas para su otra actividad.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Adrián is 27 years old and lives with his parents. He has a son who is dependent on him. Adrián lives in San Lorenzo community, in the south of Honduras. For five years he has made a living selling new clothes and footwear for men and women. Adrián also has a minibus that he uses as a school bus. This is another source of income for him. Adrián sells the clothes at a stall at the old market in San Lorenzo. He is enterprising and wants to get ahead.

Adrián is applying for a loan in order to buy blouses, dresses, shirts, skirts, swimming trunks and shoes for his business. The local town fair is approaching and he wants to stock up the business to tend to his customers better.

With this help of this loan, Adrián plans to fulfill his need for capital and stock up his business. This loan will allow Adrián to earn higher profits that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

Adrián's dream is to own his own house and have another bus to have another job.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2014

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, shirts, skirts, swimming trunks and shoes for his business.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame FATOUMATA KLENA  débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who, on average, are 47 years old and have three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Zerlaba, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. The group is on their tenth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Fatoumata Klena, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy four 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and four drums of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit. 

Fatoumata Klena hopes to earn an average 140,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her [part of the] loan and its interest and help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is a 22-year-old female married with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Moreen operates a retail shop containing general merchandise and has been in that business for three years. Moreen began the business with the aim of looking after her family. Moreen is hardworking woman looking forward to expanding her business to a level of having a stable income. She is requesting a loan to buy soap, Nomi washing powder, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.

They are on their tenth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Nisitankan, who is standing first from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy four 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and four drums of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm one hectare of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Juana Yolanda

texts.es: Juana tiene 47 años de edad y habita junto a su madre y su hijo y su sobrina. Juana se dedica a la venta de panes con pollo, chocobananos, pasteles de carene, etc. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Juana solicita este crédto a FUSAI para invertir en el techo de su vivienda dado que no ha logrado terminar por falta de recursos económicos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, pernos, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder finalizar su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Juana, 47, lives with her mother, son and niece.  She sells chicken sandwiches, chocolate covered bananas, meat pies, etc.  She is an enterprising woman who does everything she can to support her household.

Juana is requesting a loan through FUSAI to build a roof over her house, which she has been unable to do because of a lack of resources.  With the loan she will buy metal sheeting, wood, nuts and bolts, etc.  She hopes to receive this financing and be able to finish her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, nuts and bolts, etc. to build a roof over her house.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help Zoila will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Zoila would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Sarim lives with her family in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is 49 years old and has one child. Sarim assists her husband with their rice farming business. A season for transplanting has come again and the couple needs working capital. Sarim is leading a female group member to apply for loans from VisionFund. Sarim is planning to use her loan portion on land ploughing and pesticides for the crop. Sarim wishes to make more income for the family to live in a better condition.

loans.use: To spend on land ploughing and to purchase pesticides for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She is 55 years old and she lives with her son’s family. Susanna’s son is 25 years old and he is a student at Vanadzor State University in the faculty of Physical Education. At this faculty, he studies in a distance learning way, which is very hard for this family. He is on a paid division. So Susanna works very hard and she always manages to help her son to cover his family's needs and education expenses.  Susanna has great experience in the trading field and until now, she has been running her own trading business. On a rented stall in the city wholesale market, she sells towels, covers for bed, bedclothes, pillows and a great range of blankets. She orders or brings the merchandise herself from Yerevan city and from time to time, from Turkey. She says that thanks to her regular customers, she manages to keep her business going for many years, and she is very grateful to them for being there for her.

Susanna is asking for a loan of 90.000 Armenian drams to pay her son’s tuition fee. In this summer period as she says, her business is a little bit less profitable, since a lot of people now are on their vacation.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 47 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Julie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells used clothes on a door-to-door basis. She works six days a week .She has been in this business for one year. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 300,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes . Her major challenge includes seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot and build a house. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food .

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, es una mujer muy emprendedora y carismática.
El poder salir adelante es su principal motivación para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y para el cuidado personal desde hace algún tiempo ofreciendo sus productos básicamente a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá donde actualmente reside.
Es una persona con una tenacidad impresionante y que no se deja derrumbar fácilmente por los problemas que aquejan su vida.
Ella pide un auxilio económico para la compra de productos de belleza que le permitan aumentar su inventario y mantener un nivel de ventas estable.
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá continuar con su labor y con la búsqueda de ese sueño perfecto que siempre ha querido cumplir que es la posibilidad de montar un almacén y generar empleos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very enterprising, charismatic woman.  Being able to get ahead is her main motivation for struggling day to day searching for ways to earn a living.  She sells beauty products and personal care products and has been in business for some time offering products to relatives, friends and neighbors in the municipality of Puerto Boyacá where she lives

She is a person with impressive tenacity who does not let the problems she encounters in life get in her way.  She is requesting economic support to buy beauty products to increase her stock and keep her sales volume stable.

With the help of the loan she will be able to continue her work and strive toward the goal she has always wanted to meet which is to establish a store and generate employment.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food and a new cart, table and chairs.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.

La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame MARIAM MOUSSA  assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 5.

Mariam Moussa, who is seated first from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy four 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and four drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Mariam Moussa hopes to earn an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and its interest and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Gülcan

texts.en:
Gülcan is a married mother of three daughters, two of whom are university students. She has been running a hair salon for the past 25 years. She began hairstyling by becoming an apprentice. After completing her apprenticeship, she started her own business. She says that she has arrived at where she is today by climbing the ladder of success, one step at a time. With the loan, she will buy hairstyling supplies. She continually tries to improve herself to provide greater and more quality service. In the future, she plans to open a bigger salon that includes tanning beds.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Gülcan Hanım evli üç kız annesi.  İki kız üniversitede okuyor.  Yaşadığı şehirde  yirmibeş yıldır kuaför dükkanı işletiyor.  Kuaförlüğe çıraklık eğitimi alarak başlıyor.  Başka birinin yanına çırak olarak başladıktan sonra mesleğini tamamen öğrenip kendi dükkanını açıyor.  Kendi tabiri ile basamakları birer birer çıkıp zirveye ulaşıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile kuaförlük malzemeleri alacak.  Daha büyük ve kaliteli hizmet sunmak için sürekli kendini geliştiriyor.  İleride daha büyük bir salon açıp solaryum hizmeti vermeği düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy hairstyling supplies

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady, une dame de la soixantaine d’années, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Khady vient solliciter pour la première fois, un crédit qui lui permettra de renforcer son fond de roulement afin de pouvoir acheter des céréales : mil, maïs, arachide. Elle fait de la transformation de céréales locales : couscous, poudre d’arachide. Elle se lève chaque matin à 7h et s’active autour de la préparation du couscous, et l’après-midi, elle part vendre dans le quartier.
Khady appuie à la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Grâce à son activité, elle peut appuyer à l’éducation de ses enfants, prendre en charge leur santé, et rêve de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady is in her sixties and has been active in commerce for more than a decade. She is married and a mother of a family. 

Khady is seeking a loan for the first time. This loan will allow her to increase her cash flow in order to buy cereals, such as millet, corn, and groundnuts. She will then make these into, for example, couscous and groundnut flour. 

Khady wakes up each morning at 7 a.m. and works making couscous. Then in the afternoon she goes and sells [it] in the area. 

Khady supports her family in their everyday expenses. Thanks to her business, she can support her children's education and take care of their health needs. She dreams of building a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame MARIAM YAYA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 97 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Zerlaba, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Mariam Yaya, who is seated first from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and two drums of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm a 3/4 hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Mariam Yaya hopes to earn an average profit of 97,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her [part of the] loan and its interest and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Dave

texts.en: Dave is 49 years old and a married mother of three children aged 20, 18 & 16. She wants to buy a dairy cow with a calf. Dave practices agriculture; she’s got grapevines and olive groves. For the past few years, she has been renting some agricultural land as well, where she plants mostly corn and wheat and seasonal veggies. She also keeps livestock (pigs) and poultry (chickens). Dave and her family relocated from a very rural northern village to the current one where they lived for years in a shack under very difficult living conditions, as told by Dave. They then immigrated to Greece where they lived and worked for ten years. With the money they saved, they came back and built a family house. Their goal is that they do cow farming and open up a small dairy farm as well.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow with a calf.

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame  ASSETOU SALIFOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI A. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi A group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Zerlaba, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Assetou Salifou, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy four 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and four drums of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm one hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Assetou Salifou hopes to earn an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and its interest and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Hawazan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hawazan and it consists of four women who are all hard-working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 80,000 YER. 

Owesh is 44 years old and married woman with six children. She is an educated woman with a secondary education. She has a strong determination to improve the standards of her living. She said she had a small amount of money that she saved up herself. Owesh invested that money in her own business. She has started her business two months ago selling makeup and accessories in order to help her husband in the expenses of the family. She sees this business as a profitable for her. For further expansion, Owesh requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

Owesh expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through selling more accessories, makeup, and ready-made women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is 56 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as candies, toys and school supplies. Connie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from tailoring. Connie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as candies, toys and school supplies to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. For the past five years, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites high cost of maintenance being his major challenge. 

With the loan he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 48-year-old woman. She is married with four children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Rosemary sells secondhand clothes; she has been in that business since 1999. She works very hard to expand her business and hopes to build a residential house for her children. 

Rosemary is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation and seasonality factors. She has asked for a loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa tiene 34 años de edad y habita junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos de 16 años, 15 años, 11 años, 6 año y 4 meses de edad. Teresa tiene un negocio de venta de variedad de ropa tanto para hombre como para mujer. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuneta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de contención para  el cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, grava, pilares y hierro.
texts.en: Teresa is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and their five children, aged 16, 15, 11, 6 and 4 months. Teresa has a business selling a variety of clothes, both for men and women. She has worked in this business for a long time and has a lot of experience and customers who prefer her more and more every day. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a wall for which she needs materials such as bricks, cement, posts and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, gravel, posts and iron to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Baraka* Group

texts.en:
This group is called Baraka*. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Baraka is the leader of the group. She is a 52-year-old married woman living with her family in her own house in Hodeidah. She studied until elementary education. Due to high rates of unemployment in the country, Baraka decided to leave her study. She decided to work selling perfumes and accessories door to door to help her husband with the expenses of the family. 

Baraka found this business as profitable for her. She has been in this business for more than one year. She earns good profits from this business, and for further expansion, Baraka asked for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more perfumes, accessories, and makeup for resale to the customers for more retail.

Baraka looks forward to expanding her business more through purchasing all kinds of women’s clothes, accessories, makeup, and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase more perfumes, accessories, and makeup for resale to the customers.

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 29 years old. He is a father of one child. He owns a studio and has been running sound system equipment for hire. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more equipment for his studio to have a full-fledged studio. The profits from the studio will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for his studio for hire.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
This is Mose. She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her previous loan.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicks for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for her business.

loans.name: Sofiah

texts.en:
Safiah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and two of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She is tailor. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from farming. She has been in this business for the last eight years. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy materials for making clothes. 

Her major challenge includes defaulters. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Marlene Edelmira

texts.es: Marlene de 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene una tienda y una pupuseria, su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunas de la necesidades de su hogar, Marlene solicita un crédito para invertir más en su tienda comprado granos básicos, golosinas, sopas, jugos, refrescos, jabón, detergentes, etc.   para dale a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Marlene is 44 years old. She lives in her own home with her family group. She has a store and a pupusa business. She has a lot of customers because of her friendliness and her good prices. With her profits she is able to cover some of her household necessities. Marlene is asking for a loan to invest more in her store, buying basic grains, candies, soups, juices, beverages, soap, detergents, etc., so that she can give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, soups, juices,  beverages, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Delma Adina

texts.es: Delma tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 11 años y 17 años de edad. Delma se gana la vida por medio de la venta de tamales de gallina desde hace 15 años de edad. La venta la realiza en diferentes zonas de su localidad y gracias a su carisma y deliciosos tamales que ofrece muchas personas demandan sus productos. Delma desea cambiar el techo de la vivida dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de dos docenas de lámina galvanizada y polines.
texts.en: Delma is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her two daughters, aged 11 and 17. Delma earns a living selling chicken tamales for 15 years. She sells in different areas of her community and thanks to her charisma and the delicious tamales she offers, a lot of people demand her products. Delma wants to change the roof on her house because it has deteriorated. Because of this, she has asked  FUSAI for a loan to buy two dozen galvanized sheets and rods. .

loans.use: to buy two dozen galvanized sheets and rods to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 50 years old. She is a mother of eight children, aged between six and twenty-four. She sells cows and has been in the business for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cows for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is a 50-year-old married woman from Jericho. She is a mother of four sons and four daughters. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income due to the demand. May also works to help her husband with part of the family expenses. She started four years ago making cleaning products and putting them in bottles. She sells her products to local traders. May took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more raw materials and bottles for her business. This will make her able to increase her productivity and also her income. May appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials and bottles for her business.

loans.name: Karama

texts.en: Karama appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards. He is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for resale. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He lives with his wife and one small daughter. Three years ago, Alaa started his own business, which is a cafe. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Alaa would like to improve his business and expand it. For this reason, Alaa took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy supplies for his cafe such as coffee and tea and also buy more tables. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to improve his business and also his income. He would like to open another branch soon.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some supplies for his cafe such as coffee and tea and also buy more tables.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José realiza una actividad con gran impacto social y sensibilidad ambiental en el municipio de Norcasia, se dedica al cuidado y preservación del embalse natural de este municipio.
Y es que esta no es una actividad fácil ya que debe estar pendiente de todos los detalles para preservar este paisaje y mantenerlo libre de desechos.
Adicionalmente se dedica los fines de semana al transporte de madera e insumos hacia las fincas cercanas ya que en muchas de ellas no tienen posibilidad de transportar estos elementos y es así como José contribuye con su labor. Esta actividad la realiza en mulas, animales de carga con gran capacitad de trabajo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una mula nueva ya que la que tiene ya está muy vieja para trabajar y prefiere no seguir esforzándola.
Este animal le permitirá seguir prestando su servicio a la comunidad de Norcasia y continuara contribuyendo al desarrollo de su comunidad.
texts.en:
José does a job with a big social impact and environmental sensitivity in the town of Norcasia.  He's dedicated to the care and preservation of the natural reservoir in this town.  And it's not an easy job because he has to be on the lookout for everything so he can preserve this landscape and keep it free of trash.  

In addition, on the weekend he works transporting wood and supplies to the nearby farms, many of which aren't able to transport these items.  That's how José makes a contribution with his job.  He does this job on mules, pack animals that have a great capacity for work.

Currently he's requesting a loan to buy a new mule because the one he has is too old to work and he prefers not to keep on forcing it.  This animal will allow him to keep on offering his services to the community of Norcasia and contributing to his community's development.

loans.use: to buy a new mule

loans.name: Jalal Group

texts.en:
Jalal is a group of five women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.
Radhia is the leader of the group. She is a 33 year old married woman with three children. She has some Elementary education, but she couldn't complete her studies.  Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, and she works as a housewife, living with her family in their own house. His income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family.  Radhia decided to help him in improving their living conditions.   For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food for her family.  Radhia looks forward to preparing all kinds of food for her family. She plans to open a saving account in AMB for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks, vegetables, pan dulce, soup, etc.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en:
Mayis, 50 years old, lives in the city of Vanadzor, located in the Lori region. He is already an experienced borrower, both for Kiva and Nor Horizon. He used is first Kiva loan to buy raw materials for his shoe making business.  He started making shoes for sale. Mayis has been a shoemaker for nine years, working in a small booth near his house.  A lot of regular customers, who he has known for many years, have become his friends. 
Mayis is married and has a married daughter who lives with her family, and a son, who is now working in the Russian Federation.
Mayis hopes to have his second loan from Kiva, which he wants to spend on the purchase of a new sewing machine, and some raw materials for his work.

loans.use: purchase of new sewing machine and some raw materials for his work

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 39 years old. He has five children between the ages two and thirteen years. He sells food products and has been in the business for twelve years. With the loan, he would like to buy more food products for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow, to provide milk for the entire family.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal and wood to repair his roof

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
For the past three years Mwaka, a hardworking woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya, has been selling poultry to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With this loan, Mwaka wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her enterprise and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32-year-old single woman who is blessed with one child. She has been a farmer for a period of four years and earns an income of KES 5,000  every month.

Mary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 15,000. She intends to use this amount to buy farm inputs and fertilizers.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Trinath- B Group

texts.en:
In the year 2014, five women from Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India, formed a group named Trinath-B to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. 

Gayatri, a hardworking and confident lady, is one of them. She hails from a poor family below the poverty line. She is standing extreme left with raised hand in the photo. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband, two sons age 9 and 7 years and her daughter, age 3 years, in a small mud hut. Her two sons are continuing study in government school.
 
Gayatri has been running a tiffin stall (serving small meals or snacks) for the last eight years with the hand-holding support of her husband in a rented cabin in the market. Apart from this, her husband also prepares different types of sweets items as per the order for different social festivals. Gayatri gets a monthly income of INR 5,000 from the above business. Out of this income she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.  

From the present loan, Gayatri wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, fuel, etc. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she has to replenish her stock frequently. From her little savings from her income, Gayatri has purchased a small piece of land. As her present stall is a rented one, she hopes to construct a cabin of her own on the purchased land. This will give her more confidence and there will be no risk of having to vacate it.
 
The other four members of the group are Ranju, Mamata, Sailabala and Rina, who are running a barber shop, a tiffin stall, a tiffin push cart and a rice business, respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing oil, dough, sugar, fuel etc. for her tiffin stall.

loans.name: Biti

texts.en:
Biti lives at the coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past two years, she has been selling cows and goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase cows and goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and goats for her business.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of cattle sales and purchase with her husband for 20 years. They purchase the cattle from the market and sell them in other cities. They have three buffaloes and two cows. This business helps them to meet the expenses of their family. 

Their earnings are not enough to meet the education expenses of their two children, however. Kousar has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing a good life to her children. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria de 38 años de edad vive actualmente con sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes escolares y remiendos de ropa, además tiene plantaciones de banano, naranjas, cocos y mamey con lo que mantiene su hogar. Ella ha tomado la decisión de construir una galera para lo cual solicita este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, tela metálica, cemento, grava, arena y madera.
texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old, and she currently lives with her three children who are 16, 14 and 1 years old. She is a very hard working woman who makes school uniforms and patches up clothing. She also has banana, orange, coconut and mamey fields with which she supports her home.

She has made the decision to build a chicken coop, which is why she has requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal, wire mesh, cement, gravel, sand and wood.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal, wire mesh, cement, gravel, sand and wood to build a chicken coop with a cement floor.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children and four of them go to school. She has no additional family members. Agnes sells used clothes by means of door-to-door sales. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for three years. She gets additional income from farming.

Agnes has requested for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes for sale. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old mother of four children who resides in the Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that experiences favorable weather patterns and is good for farming activities. She is very hardworking and she says, “My parents taught me to work hard from a young age and now I am independent.”

Through farming she has been able to comfortably take care of her children and provide them with the basic needs.

Elizabeth practices mixed farming and enjoys so much keeping dairy cows in her farm. Through the profits that she has been getting from selling milk, she has been able to buy more dairy cows. She has encountered a challenge of having no dairy unit, and that is why she is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to construct a dairy unit and be able to take full advantage of the increased number of cows in her farm.

Through the profits that she will generate, she will be able to comfortably take care of her family and also repay the loan on time.

Elizabeth is very ambitious and that is why she plans on opening a large enterprise where she would be selling milk products such as yoghurt and ice cream.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old single man who has been operating a motorcycle transport business for a period of two years, earning an income of 5,000 KES at the end of every month.

Samuel is servicing his second loan of 12,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to add to his personal savings to purchase another motorcycle to boost his business and serve his customers efficiently.

Samuel hopes to buy his own land and build a permanent house and become a successful young man in his community.

loans.use: add to his savings to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en: Sughra is a 39-year-old married woman doing a business of purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for the past 10 years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 5 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She is in her second loan cycle and has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a connection between her home and the drinking water service.

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Blanca de 56  años de edad, vive con sus dos  02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 15 añosa su negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña Blanca el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  café, huevos, granos básicos, carnes, frescos, etc. es una mujer bien trabajadora con muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia también en su negocio vende ropa nueva y cosméticos.
Doña Blanca desea surtirlo su negocio porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para este mes y quiere estar preparada para atender muy bien a sus clientes. 
Su sueño es tener una buena pulpería bien surtida que sea la mejor de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Blanca is 56 years old, and she lives with her two children who live at home. She lives in the community of Nacaome, in the south of Honduras. She has her own house, and she has worked for 15 years in her business selling groceries.

Blanca needs the loan to purchase coffee, eggs, basic grains, meats and fresh produce. She is a woman who works hard to get her family ahead. She also sells new clothing and cosmetic products at her business. Blanca wants to stock her business, because demand is pretty high this month, and she wants to be prepared to attend well to her clients. Her dream is to have her own, well stocked small grocery store that is the best in the area.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, eggs, basic grains, meats and fresh produce for her business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. They both go to school. 

Solange sells various items in her boutique. With the loan, she would like to buy more items for sale such as tomatoes and onions. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Nathan, who resides in the Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that is well known to have more favorable weather patterns and supports agriculture. He is a father of four children and a very dedicated and hardworking farmer who has immense knowledge of agriculture, having done agriculture for the past 10 years.

Through agriculture Nathan has been able to support his family and always provide food for them. Being a very dedicated farmer, Nathan has gained so much popularity in his village and he is touted as one of the best farmers in his village.

Nathan practices mixed farming where he does crop farming and also does dairy farming. Through profits that he has accumulated he has been able to increase his piece of land and he now grows tea.

Nathan is seeking a loan of KES 55,000 to be able to buy a posho mill that will allow him and his neighbors to grind their maize. Because of the distance that they have to travel to mill their maize, Nathan, being creative, came up with the idea of starting a posho mill in their area. Because of the good will that Nathan enjoys, he is sure that he will be of help to his neighbors and will reap more profits.

Nathan is sure of repaying the loan comfortably and helping the community reduce time wasted when they had to cover so many kilometers to get to the posho mill.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill.

loans.name: Mauricio Eliseo

texts.es: Mauricio de 40 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 2 años de edad.  Él es un hombre emprendedor que en asocio con otro familiar poseen un taller de carpintería y un carwash los cuales son muy visitado y cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus servicios por lo que todos los días tienen sus puertas abiertas. Mauricio ha logrado comprar un pequeño terreno con las ganancias de su negocio y desea construir una casa  para que sus hijos tengan un lugar seguro y propio donde vivir, por lo que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para comprar madera, lamina galvanizada, clavos y tornillos y así poder tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 40 years old, and he lives with his life partner and their 3 children who are 14, 8 and 2 years old. He is an enterprising man who owns a carpentry workshop and a car wash with another family associate. These are very well-visited, and every day he has more clients who request his services, which is why they keep their doors open every day. 

Mauricio has managed to buy a small piece of land with the earnings from his business, and he wants to build a house there so that his children may have a safe place of their own to live. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase wood, galvanized metal, nails and screws to be able to have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase wood, galvanized metal, nails and screws to build a house.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This pretty lady’s name is Mariam and she is 30 years old. She lives in Yerevan city. She has a higher education with the specialty of linguist and pedagogue. 

Many years she worked at the Yerevan poultry factory as an assistant of accounting. Now, to her delight, she works in her specialty at the Language Teaching Center as a teacher of English language. She says she likes her work very much and is happy to work in this field. She also gives private courses in English language at her flat.
 
Mariam is married and she has a nice daughter. Her husband is employed and together they try to sustain their young family’s needs.
 
Maraim hopes to have this loan since she must take part in training courses for which she must pay and she will also buy some professional literature.

loans.use: to take part in paid training courses and also buy some professional literature.

loans.name: Julio Gabriel

texts.es:
Julio vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad con un clima muy agradable, un sector caracterizado por su comercio y producción. Aquí junto a su esposa y dos hijos vive Julio, en un sector humilde de la ciudad.
Hace un año emprendió en el negocio de la compra y venta de pollos faenados, adquirió una pequeña moto y en ella comenzó a ofrecer de tienda en tienda su producto, ahora ya cuenta con clientas fijas a quien hace la entrega desde muy en la mañana todos los días, para ya en la tarde dedicarle tiempo a su familia. 
Julio comenta que es la primera vez que una institución le da la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio, se siente muy feliz y agradecido ya que con este crédito comprará otra moto para darle trabajo a un cuñado y así poder ampliar la zona  y ganar más clientela, ya que en un fututo tiene planificado ya comprarse su propia casa porque actualmente viven con sus suegros.Julio agradece a la Fundación y a Kiva por el apoyo a cumplir sus aspiraciones de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city with nice weather and an area that is characterized by its commerce and production. Julio lives here with his wife and two children, in a modest part of the city. 

A year ago, he started a business buying and selling butchered chickens, and he bought a small motorcycle through which he began to offer his product from store to store. Now he has steady clients that he delivers to early in the morning every day, so that he can spend time with his family in the afternoon.

Julio comments that this is the first time that an institution has given him the opportunity to improve his business, and he is very happy and thankful because he will buy another motorcycle with this loan to be able to employ his brother-in-law and expand his business in the area and earn more clients. In the future, he plans to purchase his own house because he currently lives with his parents-in-law. Julio thanks the foundation and Kiva for the support to fulfill his dreams of growth.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to expand his deliveries in the area.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a widowed woman with one child who goes to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking  oil.

loans.name: Blanca Rosibel

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Rosibel de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo, en casa de familiar en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva para dama, calzado y juguetes.
Doña Blanca  también trabaja como maestra de computación en una escuela y esto le genera más ingresos para su hogar, tiene su negocio ubicado un local en el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo.
Doña Blanca  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, faldas, zapatos, muñecas, carritos, peluches, etc.  Porque se acerca la época de la feria del pueblo  y desea surtir su negocio.
Doña Blanca  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para surtir su negocio y de esta manera tener mejores ganancias y mejorar un poco su condición de vida.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014
texts.en:
Blanca, 30 years old, lives with her husband in a family house in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has worked selling new women's clothing, shoes and toys for six years. Blanca also works as a computer teacher in a school, which earns her more income for her home. Her business is located in a stand in the new market in San Lorenzo. 

Blanca is requesting this loan to purchase blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, dolls, strollers and stuffed animals. The town's local festival is happening soon, and she wants to stock up her business. With the support of this loan, Blanca hopes to meet her financial needs to stock her business and to have higher earnings, and improve her living conditions a bit. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, dolls, strollers and stuffed animals for her business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 24 años de edad vive con sus abuelos, su tío, y un hermano de 14 años de edad. Su madre se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos y llega a la casa una vez al mes. Son muy reconocidos por ser una familia muy  trabajadora y emprendedora. Rigoberto es un joven muy emprendedor que trabaja en un taller de enderezado y pintura desde hace un año. Rigoberto necesita construir un corredor en su vivienda dado que cuando llueve el agua se filtra y daña sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior  solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y grava para proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 24, is a young entrepreneur who has worked for a year in a paint and body shop.  He lives with his grandparents, his uncle, and a 14-year-old brother.  His mother makes a living providing housekeeping services and returns home once a month.  The family is known for being hardworking and enterprising.

Rigoberto needs to build a passageway on his house because the water seeps in when it rains and damages what few belongings he has.  For that reason he's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal, wood, cement, sand, and gravel so he can proceed with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a passageway

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Uganda, in Kampala. She is married with one child and she goes to school. She has additional family members. She sells food. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for two years. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and Irish potatoes for sale. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van in the future to ease transportation. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Tawheb Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tawheb. It consists of five women and two men. All of them are living in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials).

Fathia is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, and she is living with them in her own house in one of the Taiz villages in Yemen. Her oldest child is 16 years old, and the youngest one is 3 years old. Because of the high rates of the poverty and illiteracy in the country, most people are illiterate; Fathia is one of the people who are illiterate.  

The raising of goats and selling them is her sole income source, and she doesn't have another. She has started in this business many years ago. She inherited this business from her parents. Recently, she has a small amount of goats, and she wants to increase her capital. As a result, Fathia applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy more goats in order to raise and sell them. So, she has a good experience in raising goats and reselling them.  

Fathia's dreams are to have a large farm that will allow her to provide her family with all the necessary things they need.

loans.use: to buy more goats in order to raise and sell them

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 24-year-old married woman who is blessed with two children. Her husband adds additional income to facilitate the well-being of their family.  Priscilla has been operating a quarry mining business, or stone cutting business, for a period of six years, earning an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Priscilla is servicing her third loan of 45,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to hire some manual labor men who will assist in her quarry business. 

Priscilla plans to use the anticipated income to expand her business by building a general store for the quarry business and to educate her children. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman and buy family land.

loans.use: To hire men who will assist in manual work in her construction business.

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
The Trust in God Group is made up of five women who all live in the same neighborhood in Ghana. They are into eggs, wigs, beans, rice, oil, gizzards and batik tie and dye.

Celestina is the group representative. She is 46 years old and married to Samuel. Together, they have two children who both attend school, and for whom they are responsible. Celestina and Samuel live together with their children, and both provide for the expenses of their household.

Celestina left school at the secondary level and began selling rice, beans and cooking oil twelve years ago. She is very successful with her business, which allows her to provide for her needs and those of her children. She buys rice, beans and salad oil from the market and sells it to customers. 

She would like to be able to respond better to the demands of her customers, so she has requested this sixth loan, with the other members of Trust in God, from the field partner. This loan will enable them to fulfill their customers' needs and make more profit. The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buys rice, beans and salad oil from the market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school and one is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sweets for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Naiime

texts.en: Naiime is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children. Naiime has been working in the agriculture sector for the past ten years in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting for her business. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. She is certain that with the new merchandise, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, posts, and wire mesh to build a washing basin and fence in his property.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more goods and items for the grocery.

loans.name: Christiane

texts.en: Christiane is a Cameroonian aged forty-five and married with five children. The oldest is twenty-four and in the university and the youngest is ten in primary school. She has been in this business for over fifteen years, which makes her very experienced and her business profitable and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers (many restaurants which deal in rabbit meat). This loan will be used to increase her turn-over by ten percent and her profit by seventeen percent.

loans.use: to buy rabbits to raise and sell and also to buy rabbit feed.

loans.name: Emel

texts.en:
Emel has two children, one is nine and the other three. Because of economic problems, she began selling clothes to contribute to the household and provide for her children. She never had any problem doing this work. She sold to her friends, relatives and acquaintances. With the loan, she will buy underwear and increase her selection.
