For over a year she has been making a living selling food such as fried chicken, hamburgers, and kebabs at the various festivals that happen in the area. Things are going well for her, because she is a very responsible, hard-working and honest person. She is attentive to the customers and above all she offers quality food at a good price.

Fiorella is grateful for the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have given her, she will be able to buy tables and chairs to give her customers better service so that she can increase her sales. This way she will continue making an effort to improve her family's quality of life little by little and later she can achieve one of her biggest goals: "To expand her business".

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to expand her business of selling fried chicken.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, actualmente se encuentra soltera con 4 hijos y 2 de ellos viven con ella y estudia 8° grado y el menor aun no ingresa a la escuela, de la cliente dependen sus hijas y nadie más vive con ellas. 

María desde unos 12 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura, además es comerciante de ganado  y aprendió este negocio ya que su yerno se dedica a eso y le gusto trabajar con el ganado, compra el ganado en las comunidades cercanas donde reside. 

Necesita del crédito para la compra de ganado de repasto, para seguir dándole continuidad al negocio.

Su sueño en un futuro es tener ganado propio, poder reproducirlas y luego vender, además espera que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She has a sixth-grade education. She is currently single, with four children. Two of them live with her; one is in 8th grade, and the other has not started school yet. Her daughters depend on her and no one else lives with them.

For twelve years, María has earned her living in farming. In addition, she sells cattle. She learned this business through her son-in-law, who earns his living that way, and she likes working with the cattle. She buys the cattle in communities near where she lives. She needs the loan to purchase cattle to fatten so that she can continue developing her business. 

Her dream for the future is to have her own cattle and to be able to breed and then sell them. She also hopes for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten in order to continue developing her business

loans.name: Dario Abelino

texts.es:
Dario es un hombre trabajador, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en Palpa junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y todas las comodidades que ellos se merecen.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en una Institución Financiera y le va muy bien ya que es una persona muy responsable, emprendedor, honesto y porque siempre atiende a los clientes con esa amabilidad que lo caracteriza buscando su bienestar.
Dario está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá realizar mejoras a su vivienda como empezar a construir su casa de material noble para que de esta manera su familia viva en un ambiente mucho más seguro y cómodo, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y podrá ir tranquilo a trabajar con la certeza que su familia se encuentra bien. Así poco a poco seguirá luchando para más adelante "Tener un negocio propio".
texts.en:
Dario is a hardworking man, 28 years old, who lives in Palpa with his wife and young son. 

His biggest motivation in life is his family. It is for them that he fights, day in and day out, so he can offer them a better quality of life and all the comforts they deserve.
For more than a year he has worked in a Financial Institution, which is going quite well for him as he is a very responsible, enterprising, and honest person, and because he always attends to his clients with his characteristic friendliness, seeking their well-being.

Dario is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have given him, he will be able to make improvements to his place of residence, such as beginning to build his house out of strong materials so that his family can live in a much safer and more comfortable environment. In this way he will be improving their quality of life and will be able to go to work with peace of mind and the certainty that his family is well. So, little by little, he will continue fighting so that in the future he can "have a business of my own."

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes performs mixed farming to earn her living. For the past two years, she has planted tea, kept chickens, and engaged in dairy farming. By combining these three agricultural activities, she is able to make ends meet. 

Agnes is the caring, loving mother of three children. The family lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, a highland area with a significant amount of rain. Agnes chose mixed farming as a way to overcome the challenges of dense population and land scarcity in the Kisii area. Through her hard work, Agnes is able to bring smiles to her children's faces. She enjoys her work, and every day she brings renewed energy to the farm. This attitude keeps her spirits up throughout each day.

Agnes is seeking a loan in the amount of KES 62,400 in order to buy a dairy cow. She currently has one dairy cow nicknamed "Maridadi,” which in Swahili means "wonderful." She knows that the addition of a new dairy cow will also be "wonderful," since she will be able to produce more milk and milk products to offer for sale in her community. In this way, she will be better able to alleviate the poverty level of her family.
 
In the future, Agnes intends to send her children to the best schools she can afford, so that they can attain a good education and give back to their community. She believes that this loan is the first step to achieving these goals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with four children and three of them go to school.  She has no additional family members.   She lives in rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent.

She sells used clothes at the market on retail basis. She works six days a week .She has been in this business for 8 years. She has requested for a loan of Ugandan shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes for sale. Her major challenge includes seasonality.   

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot and build a house.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Doris Melina

texts.es:
Doris de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañado su  compañera de vida trabaja como ordenanza en un rancho, ella tiene un  hijo que estudia. 

 Doris se dedica a la venta de comida en eventos  y en los ratos libres  trabaja como costurera, tiene mucha experiencia en dichas actividades y lo aprendió de sus padres  y su esposo se dedica también a la agricultura cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados  de maíz junto a su esposa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar un friser y  bebida para el negocio, también su esposo comprara insumos para el cultivo de maíz y tener mejores ingresos para su familia  y mejorar la calidad de vida para sus hijos  y vivir en mejores condiciones.

 Doris desea construir una  vivienda digna y  preparar académicamente a su hijo  y poder hacer crecer su negocio un poco mas y que Dios le de salud para seguir trabajando para que esto se le haga realidad y gracias a los créditos espera lograrlos.
texts.en:
Doris is 36 years old and went as far as ninth grade in school. She lives with her life partner who works on a farm. She has a son who goes to school.

Doris sells food at events, and in her free time works as a seamstress. She has a great deal of experience in these activities and learned them from her parents. She and her husband also farm 7000 m² of corn.

The loan she is requesting from Credicampo is to buy a freezer and drinks for her business, and also for her husband to buy agricultural supplies for growing corn. This is to have better income for the family, improve their children's quality of life and have better living conditions. 

Doris wishes to build a decent home, help her son with his education, and be able to see her business grow a little more.  She hopes God gives her health so that she can keep working so that this can become a reality, and thanks to the loans she hopes to achieve these dreams.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and drinks for her store, and also her husband will buy agricultural supplies for growing corn.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
Alba de 24 años de edad,  estudió hasta últimos años de estudios secundarios, está felizmente acompañada, su compañero de vida es peluquero y tiene que viajar en bus todos los días para ir trabajar en la peluquería que tienen en la ciudad, tienen un niño de cinco años al que cuidan mucho. Viven en casa de sus suegros (los padres de su esposo), en donde viven un cuñado, la abuela de su esposo, él y ella junto con su hijo. 

Alba se dedica al comercio de ropa, cosméticos y enchape. La ropa la trae de la ciudad y la vende en su comunidad, en donde las clientes la visitan específicamente para comprarle pues saben que trae buena mercadería. Este negocio lo lleva realizando durante varios años, pues inició cuando su hijo nació y tuvo que buscar la manera de ganarse la vida para él.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar camisas, blusas, faldas, jeans, ropa interior. Pues la demanda está creciendo y es una oportunidad para crecer económicamente.

Alba sueña con llegar a tener una tienda de ropa formal, que se encuentre ubicada en el centro de su comunidad, para así de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias y que su familia puedan gozar de una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is 24 years old. She studied through the final years of high school, and is happily partnered. Her life partner is a hairdresser and has to travel by bus every day to go to work at a salon that is in the city. They have a five year old child who they love very much. They live at home of his in-laws (husband's parents). In the home are Alba’s husband’s parents, her husband's grandmother, her husband and she along with their son.

Alba makes a living in the business of clothing, cosmetics and plated goods. She brings the clothing from the city and sells it in her community, where customers visit specifically because they know that she brings good merchandise. She has had this business for several years, starting when her son was born and she had to find a way to make a living for him.

Alba needs this loan to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, jeans, underwear. As demand is growing, there is an opportunity to grow economically.

Alba dreams of having a formal-wear shop located in the center of their community, and to earn higher profits so that her family can enjoy an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, jeans, underwear to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with four children and three of them go to school.  She has additional family members.   She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

She sells clothes used clothes at the market on retail basis, working six days a week.  She gets additional income from rental houses. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

Florence has requested for a loan of Ugandan shillings 800,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes for sale.  Her major challenge includes seasonality of her products .  Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot and build a house.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco  de 59 años de edad, no estudio pero si sabe firmar, esta acompañado, su esposa se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos; son padres de 3 hijos.

Francisco  se dedica a la agricultura y pesca artesanal, el cual ya tiene 16 años de hacer dichas actividades, las aprendió de sus padres. El lugar de trabajo esta a  unos 800 metros de su casa . Antes se dedicaba a obrador de salinas. En las actividades que realiza en la actualidad  le ayuda su esposa y  un hijo  de la mañana de 6:30 a.m. a 10:30 a.m.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 4 sacos de sulfato para el cultivo de maíz y 2 de urea para 14,000 metros cuadrados de ajonjolí el cual espera tener buena cosecha y tener buenos ingresos económicos para su familia.


 Francisco desea continuar su vivienda y con las ganancias de su cultivo poder comprar una ternera, mientras su esposa sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado  y espera seguir cultivando que Dios le de salud para seguir trabajando para que esto se le haga realidad y gracias a los créditos espera lograrlos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 59 years old. He never went to school but he did learn how to sign his name. He lives with his partner, who works selling shellfish. They have three children together.

Francisco works farming and fishing, and has been doing so for sixteen years. He learned these trades from his parents. His workplace is located about half a mile from his home. Before this, he used to work in the saltworks. His wife and one of his children help him with his current businesses from 6:30 am to 10:30 am.

He will use the loan he is requesting from CrediCampo to buy four sacks of sulfate for his corn crops and two sacks of urea for his 3.5 acres of sesame. He expects the harvest to be good and to make a good financial income for his family.

Francisco wants to keep working on his housing, and he will also use the earnings from his harvest to buy a calf. In the meantime, his wife's dream is to have a stand in the market and she also hopes to continue farming. He prays for God to give him good health so that he can continue to work and make their goals a reality. Thanks to these loans, he expects to be able to do so.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of sulfate and two of urea for his corn and sesame crops.

loans.name: Ema Yaoska

texts.es: Ema es una jovencita que tiene la edad de 19 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de meses de nacido habita con su anciana madre a quien apoya económicamente gracias a los ingresos que genera la actividad comercial que realiza vendiendo sopa todos los fines de semana en su casa de habitación, con deseos de salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia Ema solicita el apoyo de crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando verduras carne con hueso, pollo, leña, carbón entre otros que ayuden a aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Ema is a nineteen-year-old young girl. She is a single mother and her son was born a few months ago. She lives with her elderly mother, whom she supports financially thanks to the income she makes from her business. In order to get ahead and improve her and her family's quality of life, she sells soup every weekend from her home.

Ema is requesting the support of this loan to invest in her business by purchasing vegetables, bone-in meat, chicken, firewood, charcoal, and other items that will help her sales increase.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, bone-in meat, chicken, firewood, charcoal, and other items.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with four children and all of them go to school.  She has no additional family members.  She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.  

Jalia sells charcoal at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis, working six days a week.  She has been in this business for 14  years. She gets additional income from rental houses.

She has requested for a loan of Ugandan shillings 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to sell.  Her major challenge includes  transportation and thieves.  Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Cinthia Pamela

texts.es:
La joven  Cintia  de  27  años de edad, vive con su conyugue y  tiene  un hijo que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de ropa usada clasificada, también vende ropa nueva, carteras, lociones, sus clientes son los amigos y familiares, también vende con los empleados de una finca de melón, cercana a su comunidad, está ubicada en la comunidad de san Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  Cintia es una joven emprendedora con deseos de superarse ya que también estudia en la universidad por las tardes y los ratos libres los dedica a su negocio que lo realiza de forma ambulante.
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de dos fardos de ropa clasificada de hombre y mujer también vende joyas de acero. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos, y de esta manera desea mejorar su forma de vida y salir adelante también en sus estudios, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y KIVA, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita.
Su sueño es tener una casa para ella y su hijo.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Young Cintia, 27 years of age, lives with her husband and has a dependent child.  She has had a business selling used clothing for five years.  She also sells new clothing, handbags and lotion. Her customers are her friends and relatives.  She also sells to the employees on a melon farm near her community.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Cintia is a young entrepreneur who wants to get ahead because she is also studying at the university in the afternoons.  In her free time she runs her business, which she operates door to door.

She is requesting a loan to purchase two bundles of men ad women’s clothing. She also sells steel jewelry. With the support of this loan she plans to improve her earnings and in this way she wants to improve her way of life and to get ahead, as well, in her studies. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma and KIVA. This is her fourth loan.

Her dream is to own a house for herself and her son.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of clothing for women and men and steel jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 44-year-old man who is married and has been blessed with four children aged between 18 and seven years. He sells ladies' handbags, a business he has done for the past nine years, providing an income that is able to cater for his families needs.

He has requested for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya so that he can add more stock of newer handbags to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to save for his children's education as well as open a shop for selling the bags.

In future he would like to build a home for his family as well as open more shops elsewhere.

loans.use: to add more stock of handbags to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old, married to Omuse, and they are blessed with four children, all of whom are older than 15.  For over 19 years Rose has been selling assorted cereals and earns a monthly income of KES.24,000.

This is her second loan of KES. 40,000 from Visionfund Kenya and she plans to buy more cereals to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to open a new branch.

She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bertier Paul

texts.es:
Bertier es un joven emprendedor, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Calleria junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Con mucho esfuerzo estudió la carrera profesional de Contabilidad y desde hace más de 1 año ejerce su profesión en una gran empresa, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador y honesto.
Bertier está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una computadora para que pueda realizar sus trabajos sin ningún inconveniente y de esta manera obtenga resultados favorables en el trabajo. Gracias a eso seguirá luchando para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Bertier is a young entrepreneur. He is 28 years old, single and lives in Calleria with his family. He is a person eager to get ahead. The greatest motivation in his life is his family. He struggles day after day to get ahead so that he can give them a better future.

He painstakingly studied to become an accountant and for more than a year he has performed  in this capacity at a large company. He is doing very well because he is very responsible, hardworking and honest. 

Bertier is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him he will be able to purchase a computer so that he can do his work without any inconvenience and thus he will obtain favorable outcomes at his job. Thanks to that, he will continue struggling so that in the future he will be able to fulfill his great dream of having his own business.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 46-year-old woman who is is married and blessed with six children. Her children are aged between 21 and 5 years and all in school. She is involved in the business of making bricks, while her husband is employed and contributes to the family's monthly income. She has been in this business for the last 12 years, with a monthly profit of KES 40,000 (Kenya shillings).

Ruth has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy solar lamps and energy-saving jikos (cooking pots) for her home. She hopes her business does well, so that she can repay her loan and also save towards the education of her children.

In the future, Ruth hopes to have a very stable business.

loans.use: to buy solar lamps and modern energy-saving jikos.

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolores de 32 años de edad,  está felizmente acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tienen tres hijos, los cuales todavía están estudiando y  no vive nadie más junto con ellos.

Dolores es una mujer de hogar, se dedica únicamente a los cuidados del hogar y de sus hijos, sus ingresos dependen de su esposo el cual tiene terrenos en los cuales siembra granos básicos, tiene que caminar 30 minutos para llegar al cultivo, también trabaja para otros como jornalero. Tienen 2 animales (vacas), las cuales en cualquier momento se podrían volver fuentes de ingresos, ya sea con su leche o con su carne. Su hijo mayor se involucra también en el trabajo de campo en ayuda para su padre.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insecticidas, fungicidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas etc. así como pago de mano de obra, para la siembra de maíz. 

Dolores sueña con ver a sus hijos crecer sanos y fuertes y que lleguen a ser personas de bien, que sirvan a su familia y a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Dolores is 32 years old and happily married. Her husband earns a living through agriculture and raising animals. They have three children, who are still in school, and no one else lives with them.

Dolores is a homemaker. She's dedicated solely to household work and her children. Her income depends on her husband, who has land on which he plants staple foods. He has to walk for 30 minutes to get to the crop, and he also works for others as a laborer.

They have two animals (cows), which at any moment could return revenue, either with their milk or meat. Their oldest son was also involved in fieldwork to support his father.

The requested loan is to buy insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, herbicides, etc., and to pay for labor for planting corn. Dolores dreams of seeing her children grow up strong and healthy and becoming good people who serve their family and community.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. and to pay for labor for planting corn.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, no siguió estudiando pues a consecuencia de la guerra civil que azoto en el país, fue reclutado por los militares del país donde lo obligaron a incorporarse a la lucha armada en los años ochentas y noventas.

Es padre de dos hijos uno de los cuales estudia en el centro escolar de la comunidad, su esposa está pendiente de la pequeña tienda que posee en la colonia donde viven.

José se dedica a la prestación de servicio pues tiene un molino de nixtamal desde hace cinco años en su pueblo natal, se levanta todos los días a las cuatro de la mañana para iniciar sus labores diarias en el molino, tiene bastante clientela que llega a su lugar a moler maíz, café y otros. Se decidió en este rubro debido a que en la zona no había molino y les tocaba que caminar por largos trayectos hasta llegar al molino. Antes José trabajo por cerca de cinco años en una panadería en la ciudad.

Mientras él trabaja en el molino todos los días su esposa y su hijo atienden la pequeña tiende de donde también obtiene ingresos económicos para mejorar así su calidad de vida.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar detergentes, embutidos, galletas, bebidas, arroz, sal, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, leche, etc. para surtir la tienda. Con lo que pretende incrementar su inventario para ofrecer más variedad de mercadería de donde obtendrá mayores ingresos económicos. El resto lo necesita para arreglar uno de sus molinos que posee y así podrá contar con un mejor equipo para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
El sueño de José es construir una casa para sus hijos donde ellos puedan vivir más cómodamente, también pretende poco a poco ir creciendo con su tienda familiar que posee en la comunidad. 
Está en toda disposición de apoyar a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando en la universidad y que se preparen académicamente para mejorar así su futuro.
texts.en:
José, age 63, went to school through the fourth grade.  He did not continue his education because of the civil war that scourged the country.  He was recruited by the country’s military, and they forced him to join the armed fight in the 80’s and 90’s.  

He has two children, and one of them goes to the community school center.  His wife looks after the small store that she has in the neighborhood where they live.

José has been providing service with his mill in his hometown for five years.  He gets up at four in the morning every day in order to start his daily work with the mill.  He has plenty of customers that come to his place to grind corn, coffee, and others.  He decided on this field of work because there was no mill in the area.  People had to walk a long way to get to the mill.

José worked for close to five years at a bakery in the city.  While he works at the mill every day his wife and his son tend to the small store where they also get income to improve their quality of life.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy detergent, sausages, cookies, drinks, rice, salt, beans, sugar, eggs, and milk, etc. to stock the store.  By doing so he intends to increase his inventory in order to offer a greater variety of merchandise from which he will get greater income.  He needs the rest to fix one of the mills that he has.  This way he will be able to have better equipment to give his customers better service.

José’s dream is to build a house for his children.  They will be able to live more comfortably there.  He also intends to be growing with the family store that he has in the community.

He is completely willing to support his children continuing their education at the university so that they prepare academically to improve their future.

loans.use: to buy detergent, sausages, cookies, drinks, rice, salt, beans, sugar, eggs, and milk, etc. to stock the store and to fix one of his mills.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 39-year-old man. He is married to Joyce, who adds an additional income to support the well-being of their family, and they have been blessed with seven children. Dominic has been running a livestock business for a period of 10 years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.  

Dominic was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a friend and is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000. He intends to add more stock of livestock cattle to sell to his customers. He plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children. 

Dominic hopes to buy a family land and become a successful businessman in his community.

loans.use: To add to his personal savings to buy additional livestock for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as various fertilizers and manure to care for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Bublen-A Group

texts.en:
Binodini, about 52 years old, is a permanent resident of Tetelkhunti village in the Bolangir district in Odisha, India. Tetelkhunti is a rural village in one of the poor region of the state. She hails from a poor family in that village. She is an active micro entrepreneur. In May 2014, she and five other women entrepreneurs in her village formed a group named Bublen-A to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. The lady sitting second from right in the photo raising her hand is Binodini. She lives with her husband and one son, 22 years old, in a small house. Her son helps in her business.

Binodini is running a small business frying bold gram and selling it at retail for the last 12 years. She fries the bold gram and her husband and son move from village to village to sell it. She purchases raw bold gram in bulk, fries it and sells it. In a week, she purchases 100 kgs of gram. From this business, she gets a monthly income of Rs 6,000.  Out of this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Binodini wants to purchase more stock of raw gram from the present loan to run her business throughout the rainy season, which is a lean period for her. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she has to replenish her stock frequently. As her son is already at the marriageable age, Binodini hopes to save enough for building a good house of her own and completing the marriage of her son in the near future.
 
The other five members of the group are Sunanda, Tapaswini, Rebati, Saraswati and Basanti who are running a tailoring center, a cycle repair center, bold gram selling, and puffed rice selling businesses, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase bold gram in bulk

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of them go to school. She has one additional family member. She is a tailor at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy material for making clothes. Her major challenge includes transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine and also to open up a training center for fashion and design. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy material for making clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and first-class potato seed

loans.name: Naomy

texts.en:
Naomy is a 23-year-old lady who is married and blessed with one child who is 10 months old. She practices farming but also has a secondary business of motorbike transportation. She has been doing these two businesses for the last two years with a monthly profit of 12,000 Kenyan shillings.

She has applied for her second loan from us with us, which she plans to use to buy some seeds and fertilizers for planting and to service her motorbike. She hopes to make good profits, which she will use to cater to the needs of her family members.

In the future she would love to give the best to her family.

loans.use: To buy some farm supplies as well as service the bike

loans.name: Bublen-B Group

texts.en:
Bublen-B is a Joint Liability Group formed by five rural poor women entrepreneurs of Tetelkhunti village in the Bolangir district in Odisha, India. Tetelkhunti is a rural based village in one of the poor region of the state. Tarulata, about 54 years old, is one of the members of this group. She hails from a poor family and lives with her husband, one son age 19 and one daughter age 17. 
 
Tarulata has been running a small business of frying gram and selling it at retail for the last 17 years. This is the only source of income for her. She fries the gram and her husband and son sells it at retail by moving from village to village. She purchases raw gram in bulk and fries it to sell. In a week, she purchases 100 kgs of gram. From this business, she gets a monthly income of Rs 5000.  From this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and business expenses. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Tarulata wants to purchase more stock of raw gram with the loan to run her business throughout the rainy season. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she purchases the stock on a regular basis. Tarulata hopes to construct a house and complete the marriage of her son and daughter respectfully. The other four members of the group are Sabita, Nilakanti, Gita and Malli who are running fried gram selling businesses and fish businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of raw grams to sell
